objective: Aid Offa by slaying an Elf that hunts him
description:
As I was exploring the lands that lie east of Lórien and west of the great river Anduin, I was approached by a dark-skinned man. 
He moved stealthily in the wilderness. He claimed he was trailed by an elven scout of Lórien. He last saw the tall, wiry elf 
scouting along the banks of Anduin to the south.

It was apparent during our meeting that we both sought to serve the will of the Dark Lord. The offer of a reward on part of him 
was enough to sway me into assisting him in the slaying of the elf. He asked that I bring him the elf's cloak as evidence of its 
demise.

I brought the elf's blood-covered cloak to Offa who cackled and was clearly very pleased. He gave me with some poison ingredients 
as a reward stating that I would surely find a way to use them.
walkthrough:
Quest loads if Offa starts talking to you after you approach him. He claims that he's trailed by an elven scout from Lorien and 
asks you to bring him the elf's cloak as evidence of the scout's demise. Find Coubhel the elven wanderer, usually he sneaks around 
somewhere east of the Lorien borders. Kill him and bring the cloak back to Offa for the reward.
reward: a small fluid-sack, a grey fluid-sack
achievement: You assisted Offa the scout in dispatching the Lórien elf who was stalking him.

objective: Contribute the palantir of Amon-Sul to the library
description:
During my travels I found a secluded library under a blackhatch on within the Gladden Fields. I was greeted by Azra-Zaira, who 
wished to preserve anything that held regards to Numenor. She requested that I retrieve the lost Seeing Stone of Amon-Sul and 
return it to her so that it would benefit all who may bend it to their will.

I contributed the Seeing Stone of Amon-Sul to the library of Azra-Zaira and received a star charm in return.
walkthrough:
Forostar north. Orrostar east. Hyarrostar southeast. Hyarnustar southwest. Andustar west. Mittalmar center. 'Look star' in the 
room reveals a map with the texts: N E SE SW W C in the directions nort, east, southeast, southwest, west and center. You have 
to push the stake with the right region to the right spot. So for instance if N is in the southeast you have to push Forostar to 
the southeast. You need a palantir from the Death Knight to get the reward.
achievement: You contributed the Seeing Stone of Amon-Sul to the library of Azra-Zaira.

objective: Find Buttercup, Farmer Ocher's favourite cow
description:
As I was travelling through the fertile lands of the Anduin Vale I met with a distraught farmer. His favourite cow, Buttercup, 
has wandered off and he thinks that she may have gone in the direction of the evil forest to the east. I'll keep an eye out for 
a brown and white cow with a cowbell.

I found the cow. She was scared for her life after having been cornered by giant spiders. She's home now at last and Farmer Ocher 
was very happy to see her again. In return, Farmer Ocher gave me some items that had been left by a brave traveller who died 
fighting against trolls many years ago. I hope I can put them to good use against the trolls soon.
walkthrough:
Farmer Orcher will ask you to find his cow Buttercup who left to the Mirkwood direction. Buttercup can be found some east area 
with spiders or inside Mirkwood (go in from the gate) with the spider. Kill the spider and 'lead cow' back to the farmer. Bears 
cant lead Buttercup, return to human form to do it.
reward: curdled milk, wooden pipe, forest green cloak or yew longbow, 250 xp
achievement: You recovered Buttercup, the favourite cow of Beorning farmer Ocher.

objective: Help Coubhel find evidence of the man's loyalties
description:
I found a tall, wiry elf in the lands east of Lórien and west of the great river Anduin named Coubhel. This elf helped protect 
the borders of the Golden Wood from evil and lamented that it was so difficult to tell a friend from a foe when it came to men.

He had been trailing a mystery scout and was unable to learn more. He said that the man tended to stay nearby in the north; 
avoiding the forest and staying close to the river. He requested an insignia to help find out something about this man's loyalties.

I returned to Coubhel with an enamelled cloakpin which caused the elf to brighten up and make a comment that he was suspicious 
for no reason. This mystery man was a friend of the Wise, and I was rewarded with a gift for my efforts.
walkthrough:
Coubhel wanders in the area past the eastern Lorien bridges (he sneaks), or he is at his Flet (5e n 3e u from Slender Bridge. 
Coubhel the elven wanderer will give you an idea, depending on his response when you ask him "lute", whether or not you can 
complete the quest. The quest doesn't load always. If it doesn't load, he will tell you where he hid his boat or give you bless. 
If the quest loads, he will ask you to bring an insignia from a mystery man.. Find Offa the scout (who will also try to get you 
to kill Coubhel if you are not an elf, beware though, while you will get rewarded, this is an evil act). Kill Offa and bring the 
enamelled cloakpin back to Coubhel. To repeat this quest you don't need to trigger it again, just hand over the cloakpin.
reward: 5 gold, lembas wafer, gingsen root (~25% chance)
achievement: You helped the Coubhel solve the mystery of the man sneaking around Lorien's borders.

location: the Anduin Vale, A Restored Hobbit Hole
objective: An Elven scout tells a tale of a lost dagger
description:
Somewhat south and west of the town of Ingrove, near the great river Anduin, I came upon a cleverly camouflaged wooden door. Upon
knocking on it, I was welcomed by an elven scout from Rivendell. I noticed his weapon; it was unlike any I had seen on any of the
elves from the fair halls of Imladris. Curious, I asked him about it, and he shared with me the reason for the rarity of said weapon.
He mentioned having lost a dagger like his own in a fight with one of Sauron's minions after throwing it in a failed attempt to 
slay it as it managed to run away. Given the rarity of the weapon, I thought of searching for it and returning it to its owner.

South of the hills where I found the elven scout I found myself in small, yet dark, forest infested with trolls. Evidence suggested
that the goblin had either died or managed to rid himself of the dagger. After braving the dangersof the forest I found the scout's 
dagger. I returned it to him and he rewarded me generously for my troubles.
walkthrough:
An elven scout loads south of Ingrove,  and it's behind a hidden woodendoor. Knock this door to open it. The elf is missing one 
of his elven daggers. The dagger he is missing loads in the forest with trolls and a goblin corpse just south of him, either hidden 
in one of the rooms or in the corpse.
achievement: You retrieved the dagger lost by one of Elrond's scouts in a goblin attack near the Anduin.

objective: Help Enidale recover the lost ring of his people
description:
In the heart of the Anduin Vale, I stumbled upon the ghostly figure of Enidale. This spectral being lingered mournfully at the 
tomb by day, only to emerge at nightfall, drifting aimlessly. Enidale's ethereal essence carried a profound yearning for its lost 
ancestral ring, taken by a dark-skinned thief.

Having returned Enidale's cherished ring, a sense of tranquility descended upon the spirit. I was bestowed with a reward as a 
token of Enidale's appreciation. With a reverent gaze, the ghost dissipated into the ethereal realms, finding solace in the 
restoration of its long-lost possession.
walkthrough:
First you need to find Offa the scout. Kill him and loot the key from his pouch. Open deadplants, go down, kill the spiders and
loot the chest (it loads some rings which can be sold).The golden quartzite ring is Enidale's ring. You can keep the ring, which
acts as a bless ring when used or give it to Enidale's ghost, he appears and night around the ruined barn some e and n from the 
orkish rider camp across Anduin river. He will reward you with a black metal wristband which converts some offensive bonus into 
defense when you are on wimpy mode.
reward: Little over 2 gold in coins and rings, golden quartzite ring OR black metal wristband
achievement: You returned to the ghost of Enidale the ring of his people.

objective: Aid Freśf and be allowed the use of his oven
description:
Hidden behind some thick stems close to an area of extensive grasses I found the corpse of a large red deer. I proceeded to get
the antlers and headed to Honburg to get the baker to burn them down. When I arrived he looked in disgust at them and refused 
to help me. However he finally agreed to help if I would do a service for him: convince the beekeeper from a nearby village to 
send him some of his best honey, in order to make the famous Honburg honey-cakes. I agreed to this and went south.

Getting the beekeeper to give me honey for Freśf was no small task, he seemed amused at the request, but agreed to help me if I 
could rid him of some particularly obnoxious bees and bring him the corpse of their queen as proof. This I did  promptly and he 
fulfilled his end of the bargain sending honey to the baker.

As I entered Freśf's bakery, he recognized my achievement and proceeded, making use of his amazing strength, to break down the 
antlers and set them in a far corner of his oven to minimize their long term effect. Once he was done he gave me the dark powder 
that resulted from the charring of the antlers.
walkthrough:
Go from outside of Beorn's home: s 2e n e s open thickstems w - there loads a deer corpse with antlers in it. With antlers in 
inventory approach the baker in Honburg - he asks you for honey from the beekeeper, go to him and 'ask beekeeper honey'. He asks 
you to kill the queen bee, it lives nearby. Kill it and bring its corpse to the beekeeper. Now he says he sends some honey to the 
baker. Return to the baker, listen to him, and then give him the antlers. Now you can take the blackened burned powder to the Hag.
achievement: You secured honey for Freśf, who then burned the deer antlers and gave you the dark powder.

objective: Bring the hag in Ingrove a powder from burnt antlers
description:
I reached a dead end street in Ingrove and found myself inside a store filled with intriguing smells. As I entered, an old woman, 
obviously the owner, set her eye upon me and started sharing her experience with potions. She seemed to take some interest in me 
and asked for my assistance in getting her some apparently rare ingredient to get. At least for her it is hard to get since it is 
obtained by burning the antlers of one of the red deer that inhabit the valley - and the owner of the only oven capable of doing 
it, a baker from the Honburg village, seems to not have much love for such a process.

I returned back to the Old Hag in Ingrove with the black powder Freśf gave me. She smiled in a conniving way as she took the black 
powder and thought of a proper reward for me. She seemed to make up her mind and, as she started mixing ingredients, rambled some 
more about potions. She finished the concoction by adding some of the powder I had collected for her. She proceeded to smile in 
an impish manner as she explained the properties of the potion she had just made. She poured it into a water skin so as to allow 
me to give it to someone without arousing suspicion. I wonder what exactly it will do ...
walkthrough:
Old Hag (herbalist shop) asks every newbie around to bring her the powder of black antlers. Solve quest 'Freuf's task' to get 
the powder. When you have it bring the blackened burned powder to the Hag and receive a skin with a 'love potion'.
achievement: You have brought black powder to the Old Hag of Ingrove, and for whatever reason received a love potion as the payment.

location: Watery Pit (sw corner of Anduin Vale zone); needed 30 str to open door down
objective: Two children are missing in the Anduin vale
description:
The lands west of the Old Ford on the Anduin River have suffered lately from raids by the Orcs from the Misty mountains. I was 
wandering around the area when I encountered a old man. He was overwhelmed by grief and seemed to wander aimlessly as if looking 
for something. He shared this the plight, his grandchildren, who had been in his keeping since their parents died, had gone to 
visit friends in a village nearby. Unfortunately, Orcs stormed the village. Ever since he had not heard from them yet he claimed 
he could feel their presence and asked me to go to the ruins, where he dared not enter.

As I prepared to head that way, I saw him shift his pose to that expected from a seasoned warrior, holding an imaginary sword. 
He said he would meet me further down in the valley when we had driven out the attackers.  Was he delusional? Did these children 
really exist or were they another figment of his imagination. The answers to these questions I do not know, but in the remote 
chance that he is right and the children are alive and held by the Orcs then I must do my utmost to rescue them.

The village the farmer described had been ravaged by the servants of the Enemy. It was clear that some evil was at work there. 
A mansion that once stood proud in the village was scorched by flames. Inside was the foul sorcerer Nagash, protected by fearsome 
bears in a raging fury.

Once the beasts were dealt with and the sorcerer finally lay vanquished on the floor I found the children, Nellian and Nathein 
inside a dismal chamber. They seemed to be hoping for rescue as they asked me if I had come for them. Once I acknowledged this 
to them they followed me out of that dreadful place and I took them to their grandfather. He was ever so grateful and asked me 
to accompany him to his home. There he dug out a small token of his appreciation, a sword-shaped brooch, no doubt a memory from 
his younger years. As I watched them disappear in the distance I set my mind back to my affairs.
walkthrough:
This is the same location as the quest 'Nagash's research' for darkies. Kill Nagash and get the twins from his locked room. They 
will follow you as soon as you acknowledge that you are there to save them.  Take them to their father, the sad farmer. He wanders
in a zone west of Vale ford. He will take you to his cottage and give you his reward.
achievement: You rescued the twins of an Anduin Vale farmer from the Numenorean sorcerer Nagash.

objective: Fetch the goblet from the ancient chieftain's tomb
description:
I found Nagash in a circular chamber where he requested help. In order to complete his research, he needed a suitable container 
that was buried within the nearby tomb of an ancient chieftain. He said that timing was crucial and that I should return quickly
with a small silver goblet. He also mentioned that the tomb would have spirits and that I should defile the mural in the chamber.

I gave the goblet to Naghash and he started a ceremony. He pulled two children from a pit, tied them to an altar, and sacrificed 
them. He poured their blood into the goblet, drank from it, and fell to the ground only to disappear with a bright flash. I found 
the goblet in my hands and heard his fading voice echoing in my head 'Use the blood well!'
walkthrough:
Nagash will ask you to bring him a silver goblet. It loads on the spectre in a tomb in the ne corner of the Vale. Spectre calls 
up to 4 undeads to help him if attacked, so beware. It's pointless to kill soldiers before the spectre: it will just summon new 
ones. After it dies, the empty goblet falls to the ground - bring it to Nagash. He will sacrifice the twins and fill the goblet 
with blood.
reward: Goblet of blood (if quaffed affects you by Blood of Sauron (+2 STR))
achievement: You brought a sacrificial goblet to the Numenorean sorcerer Nagash.

location: n of the Anduin Vale, Inside a House
objective: Avenge the murder of Narv's wife and return a ring
description:
I was travelling close to the Great Forest of Mirkwood, many miles north of the village of Ingrove when I noticed, among the grassy
plains, a small house. I entered cautiously and was greeted by an old beorning. He shared with me his sad story; how a cloaked 
stranger had come one evening and broken into his home. How he had found his wife lifeless on the floor and some of their few
valuables taken. In his grief he recalled the one thing that was most important to him: her ring. He asked me to avenge the death 
of his wife and, if possible, recover this item. He suggested I look for Beol, a beorning experienced in woodcrafts and survival 
in the wilderness.

Following old Narv's suggestion I sought out and eventually found Beol the Ranger, he recalled having seen the stranger Narv had 
described to him yet he acknowledged how elusive he was. He gave me advice as to the general direction where the cloaked stranger 
had been last seen.

Beol's advice took me to the assassin. He put up quite a fight yet when he saw himself all but lost, sought to escape. After some 
chasing I finally managed to vanquish him. From the corpse I took the ring, a beautiful azure ring. I took the ring back to Narv 
who was extremely excited about it. While I expected no reward for my deed he insisted in giving me one.
walkthrough:
Find Narv who lives in a three-room house some west from Mirkwood. Listen to him and accept his quest - find the assassin who 
killed his wife, revenge for her death and return her ring to Narv. Vairr the Assassin pops in a zone n from Narv, but he can 
wander anywhere in Vale. Locate him if you are a mage, or spend some time tracking otherwise. Vairr is aggressive and can backstab 
you, so beware. On low hps (low wounded) he starts running and hiding. Kill him and bring the azure ring to Narv - he gives you 
a jade amulet or letter 
for Ingrove citizenship (til lev20).
achievement: You avenged the death of Narv the Beorning's wife and returned to him her ring.

objective: Niuldor needs help finding a cure for a fever
description:
As I travelled across the Anduin Vale, between the town of Ingrove and the forests of Lórien, I happen to run into a cleverly 
hidden refuge. I entered cautiously and found myself greeted by an grey-eyed Elf. He shared his concern over a dreadful fever that
had been afflicting the children. He had lived for many years far from Caras Galadhon and, in order to work on a cure, required 
an ancient parchment from the library of the Elven city. He asked for my assistance and I agreed to aid him if I could. 

Undaunted, I set forth to get the berries for Niuldor. Eventually I found an elderberry plant with berries in it. I took them back 
to Niuldor who was so grateful he offered to add something to my herbal kit to aid me in brewing potions.
walkthrough:
Niuldor the Herbalist will ask you to retrieve a parchment from the librarian in Lorien. Go to 'The Great Library' (s, 2u, w) from
The Shimmering Fountain) and 'ask librarian parchment'. After bringing him the parchment, he will ask you to retrieve elderberries 
from Fangorn.
achievement: You helped Niuldor the botanist to prepare a cure disease potion.

objective: Freśf wants the old Honburg hobbit mill fixed
description:
I found Freśf the baker sighing and muttering something about hobbits and a mill in the small village of Honburg within the Anduin
Vale. I asked him about that and he explained that the old hobbit mill on the hillside of the village was broken. He asked if I 
could get it in working condition such that he wouldn't have to waste time working a hand mill.

I managed to repair the mill by getting some help. The pool and channel were cleaned using a shovel to allow the water flow against
the waterwheel. The cogwheel was repaired and inserted back into the revolving mechanism. The shaft and grindstone were loosened 
by greasing, pushing, and turning the whole rotating mechanism at the same time. It was at this point that the mill started working 
again under its own power and Freśf the baker was overjoyed to never have to hand mill again.
walkthrough:
Go to Freśf, the baker, in Honburg (just west of the mill). Ask him about 'hobbit'. He will tell you that the mill east of Honburg
has been broken for some time, and that he wants it fixed. Go to the mill and go nw about three rooms to soakedfeet. Pick the door
down and go down all e. East of you is a hidden exit 'backwall', pick this open and go east and pick up the broken cogwheel. Rattlesnake 
in this room too so be careful if you are lowlev. Now you need to get this cog mended. In the room ws of the cog is a note from Rob
Sandyman saying his family are leaving the mill and going west, so follow in his footsteps and go visit his brother Ted who runs the
mill in the Shire. (Ted's mill is just north of Three-Farthings Stone). When you enter Ted will look at the cog and offer to mend it. 
Give him the cog and then leave the room. Return and Ted will ignore you and pretend he never offered to help you. 'ask ted cogwheel'
and he'll demand you go and pay his bar bill at the Green Dragon inn. Go wsesesw and enter the Green Dragon. 'ask bartender pay bill' 
and he will take 5 gold from you. Return to Ted and he'll grudgingly give you the mended cog. Now run all the way back to the mill.
  In the wheel room (1 down in the mill) 'insert cog mechanism'. Now you see that the shaft turns a bit but the waterflow to the water
wheel is blocked. Run to Ingrove, get a shovel from the armoury and get a flask of oil while you are there. Return to the mill and go
to the wheel room. Wield the shovel and "clean waterway". Now the channel is clear but still no water is flowing so go to the source 
of the problem, the calm reservoir 1w 1n of the mill. Here it looks like the boulders are the problem but they are just a red herring,
'exa pool' and you will see a load of gravel is blocking the flow. 'dig gravel' and you will clear it out. Now return to the mill and 
you will see the water wheel is turning but still the shaft is stuck. 'exa shaft' and you see that it's rusty and jammed. To fix it 
you need three people. Person one has to stand in the top room and when ready 'push grindstone'. Person two goes to the wheel room and
does 'turn shaft'. Both of these commands must be done roughly the same time so I suggest that person three stands in the top room and 
yells 3, 2, 1, go. When both 1 and 2 are pushing/turning the rust will begin to flake off the shaft. While they are still pushing and 
turning person three must 'pour oil hole' this will grease the shaft and the grindstone will turn freely now. Go back to Freuf the 
baker, he will thank you for repairing the mill and give you a letter for Loryen in Ingrove (til lev15).
achievement: You fixed the old hobbit mill on the hillside near Honburg.

objective: Serve the ebon wraith and obtain the Sceptre of Numenor
description:
In the foreboding shadows of the northern Anduin Vale, an ancient and malevolent presence, known as the ebon wraith, bides its 
time within Mirkwood forest. This dark harbinger holds the key to a powerful relic -- the Sceptre of Numenor. On the command of 
Azra-Zaira, I must seek out the ebon wraith, confront it, and fulfill its sinister commands to claim this relic of immense power.

The wraith, an extension of the Dark Lord's will, has decreed that Beorn must fall, and his deep black orb be brought forth. I 
have confronted the ebon wraith, and emerged victorious. With the Sceptre of Numenor now in my grasp, I wield a symbol of unmatched 
power and ancient glory. Yet, I must ever be mindful that this power is not freely given; it is a chain, a covenant of blood and 
shadow, binding me inexorably to the will of the Dark Lord. Thus, I am forever entwined with the malevolent forces I now serve.
walkthrough:
Visit Azra-Zaira south of Anduid Vale. When she asks 'Do you seek power, knowledge, or perhaps remembrance against sorrow?' say 
'sceptre'. Continue listening, and when she asks, 'Will you seek out the wraith once more?' say 'yes'. If you don't already have 
deep black orb from Beorn, get it. If you have orb, head Mirkwood, north Anduin Vale. Search for hidden exit that will lead you 
to ebony wraith. Enter room and when wraith asks 'Why have you disturbed me?' say 'sceptre'. Continue listening, and when he asks, 
'Power is offered, and the price is presented. Do you accept, mortal?' say 'yes'. Hand over orb after he ask you to bring it.
achievement: You forged a dark pact with the ebon wraith and obtained the Sceptre of Numenor.

objective: Find the pieces and reforge the spear
description:
In my travels, I heard tales of a mighty relic of old-- the Spear of Bearog the Beorning himself. A weapon of wonder, its shaft 
was black as the darkest night, forged from pure metal, and its glittering spearhead was nearly the size of a grown man's hand. 
If I could gather all its pieces, perhaps, with the help of a masterful smith, it could be reforged.

I gathered a piece of mithril, a black metal staff, and a glittering spearhead to complete the spear of Bearog. By combining them,
I reforged it into a gleaming blackened spear!
walkthrough:
Find the three pieces of the spear. A piece of silvery metal can be found in Moria, a black metal staff loads on Nagash in the 
Anduin Vale and a glittering spearhead loads in the skeleton in the Collapsed Escape Route (enddennw from Vale Ford). Rarely it 
might load in goblin corpse at water serpents. When you have all the pieces, as whitie, go to the The Rivendell Smithy, have all 
items in your inventory and type 'mend spearhead'. As darkie, go to a Blasted Furnace in the Goblin Town, and type 'mend spearhead'.
achievement: You found the pieces of the spear of Bearog and reforged it.

location: Wolf Glade; Small Village northwest from Ingrove
objective: Assist Beorn in defeating the terrible warg raiders
description:
As I traversed the lands east of the Old Ford across the Anduin I found a belt of tall and ancient oak trees. These oaks surrounded
the farmstead of Beorn, guardian of the those lands. I caught Beorn in a good mood and, by the fire in his Hall, he shared with 
me stories about the area. One story caught my attention; the one in which he talked about how raiding parties of strong wargs and
orcs would come and raid those lands in winter, when food in the mountains was scarce. He spoke about the difficulty in handling 
these strong and cunning raiders led by a might warg he dubbed the Warg Chief. This mighty warg had thwarted Beorn's every attempt 
to stop him. I left the farmstead with the intention of assisting Beorn and his people against these dreadful raiders.

It was a cold winter night under the full moon when signs of danger could be seen all over the Vale. Flocks of birds would suddenly
take flight, as if fleeing from a danger that could not yet be seen. And then they came the Wargs and Orcs, just as Beorn had described.
The noise of their marching upon the lands of the Beornings preceded them and in their wake they left nothing but death and destruction.

After a long battle with the minions of Sauron they were finally defeated. Despite his attempts to escape, the Warg Chief was felled
and his corpse lay on the field. I claimed his head as token of his defeat and presented it to Beorn. He was thankful and impressed
at my deed and after expressing his thanks wrote a letter for me to give to Loryen, chieftain of the village of Ingrove. Upon reading
this letter Loryen and the people of Ingrove welcomed me as one of their own!
walkthrough:
Every full moon during winter, a huge pack of orcs and wargs spawns at the Wolf Glade southeast of NOC, and marches to the Beorning 
village near Ingrove. It bashes the exits into the village, kills all the mobs there, and then returns to the Wolf Glade and 
disappears. The pack apears each full moon during Afteryule, Solmath, and Rethe, so it can happen 3-4 times a MUME year depending 
on the moon cycle phase (the phase changes only when the calendar is restarted). Kill the warg chieftain, butcher its corpse, and 
bring the head to Beorn. Beorn will give you a sealed letter in exchange for the head. Give this letter to Loryen, in Ingrove and 
you will receive citizenship.
achievement: You assisted Beorn in defeating the warg riders of Anduin Vale.

location: Inside a Hunter's Cabin, (all n, all w, all n, e, n, w from Forlond gates)
objective: Bring back the antlers of the noble stag
description:
I sold several furs and pelts to the elven trapper near Forlond and he revealed that he had heard from Dwarven traders that a 
majestic stag has been seen. This stag is as majestic as any seen in living memory! If only I could find and fell the beast I'm 
certain the trapper will reward me for its antlers.

The trapper was delighted with the antlers I was able to bring to him. They hang on his wall as a reminder of the undisputed beauty 
of the animals created by Yavanna. As a reward he furnished me with a yew longbow, an incredible piece of carpentry and a fine 
weapon for a hunter.
walkthrough:
Trapper will offer his quest only if you sell him enough pelts or furs (if he's out of money, buy some pelts from him and sell 
them back), and if the noble stag loaded. Then he will start talking about old times - just wait and nod when he asks you if you 
agree. After that go and kill the noble stag - e n w n w 2n 3w s are his 6 rooms. You are not forced to kill him yourself, you are 
even allowed to not have him on your trophy - just ask someone to help you if you can't kill him. Butcher the corpse, bring the 
antlers to the trapper and give them to him. You can solve this quest a maximum of 2 times - the second time you need to give 
(not sell!) him about 10+ furs/pelts.
reward: Yew longbow, quiver with 12 ash arrows.
achievement: You brought the antlers of the noble stag to an elven trapper.

objective: I must prove to Nordri that I am worthy
description:
Nordri's grandfather knew how to brew a special draught that makes the body heal more quickly when injured. I could find many uses 
for a powerful potion like this! The problem is that Nordri doubts that I am as capable as I say I am. To prove who is right he 
has challenged me to fetch him some items he has wanted for a long time.

He was pleased to see me bring him a marjoram plant, a jade bracelet, a huge silvery bracer, and a ginseng root.

With the last item handed over, Nordri was true to his word and shared his grandfather's secret. It seemed quite complicated so I 
wrote the whole process in my herblore journal so I can refer to it later when I need to mix it. We parted as the very best of 
friends, I think this friendship will be life-long, I certainly intend to call on Nordri again.
walkthrough:
Ask Nordri "herblore", then he will talk for a while. When he says "But there is a price." say 'price' and then say 'yes' when 
Nordri asks whether you agree. Listen to him, write down what he wants and go collect the items. Lowlevels can find the required 
items/weapons/herbs around BM or even inside the city - just ask some dwarf to check private the dwarven shops inside. Legends 
can be asked for a crystal from Willow, a topaz from Mormaeg, a golden nugget or a jade bracelet from Moria, or even a shining 
piece!

objective: Brave the mines of Ered Luin for wealth and fame
description:
I swore an oath to Theddin the Foreman to not defile or alter the work of the dwarves, nor wield a blade or speak against any dwarf
in order to enter the uncharted caves of Ered Luin. I was told that many dangers lurk within the heart of the mountain but it was 
possible to explore the mine to find wealth and fame.

I found my way through the spider-infested tunnels of Theddin's mines to wealth and fame.
walkthrough:
To enter the mines, wait until Theddin comes and say to him 'explore' after a long conversation; then go down. Talking to Theddin 
is needed only once, next time you can just pass. Though, dwarves will not allow an evil-aligner to enter, but there is another 
entrance (heavydoor) from outside BM - high str is needed to open it though. Mine zone is muddlled, find your way to the spider 
lair and kill all spiders on the way.The spider at the exit 'cover' has a key on its corpse. Loot the key then head d, s. When you 
notice a glinting item, type 'reveal key'. The spider's key is for the door before the chest (in the north-western part of the
mines, some n of mineshaft up), the glinting key is for the chest.
reward: Steel-shafted mattock, metal wall shield, amethyst, some gold in chest
achievement: You have found your way through the spider-infested tunnels of Theddin's mines.

location: Blue Mountains, Felak Uzbad Khuzdul; Moria.
objective: Find and return Thror's bones in Khazad-dum to Thorin
description:
High on the shoulder of a spur of Celebdil I found a small cavern with a crazed dwarf. He spoke in a harsh, ragged voice and 
muttered that Thror's bones were somewhere in Khazad-dūm and that they must be returned to Thorin.

I found the lost bones deep within the Mines of Moria and returned them to King Thorin II. The king expressed his gratitute by 
handing me the Hammer of Belegost as well as stating that I was always welcome within his halls.
walkthrough:
Loot a string of bones from one of Moria mobs and bring them to the King Thorin. Mobs that can load the string of bones are: 
Muranog, Hshkhlahk, Karcarak, Umuk, Shaghosh, Mezagor and Bulag. Also stationary patrol in the Muranog area, black troll in the 
Balrog area and great orc down in Mustering Stairs. String can only load if Hammer of Belegost is already loaded on King Thorin, 
so it is advised to examine the king prior to checking the Moria mobs. With the string of bones, you will be allowed to descend 
to the deeper levels of the dwarf homes where the King's throne is located even if you aren't a dwarf.
reward: The Hammer of Belegost, Blue Mountains citizenship.
achievement: You returned Thror's remains, once lost in Khazad-dum, to Thorin.

location: Bottom level of Blue Mountains, Vig's Shop
objective: Find wood to keep Vig's smelter running
description:
I was checking in on Vig to see what was new in his stock of mining equipment and he happened to mention a problem he was having. 
His supply of wood is running out and without more wood he can't turn the miner's ore into metal. I have heard that Vig is very 
picky about the fuel he uses, only the oldest trees in the forest should be cut down and the younger saplings left alone to grow 
fully. Oh, and I better not forget to take an axe!

The wood has been delivered and Vig paid; not all that much but I guess he has a business to run. At least the miners can continue 
to sell him their ore now.
walkthrough:
Vig the Smelter sometimes runs out of logs for his fire. When he does, he will ask people who come into his shop if they're willing 
to go out and get him some wood. Assuming that you agree to do so, you should go and get an axe, and then go out into the Dense 
Forest just east of the Dwarf Homes (from "End of the Worn Trail", s 3e). Wander around the Dense Forest, and eventually you will 
find a "A tall and sturdy oak tree" (it will be clear, when you see it, that this is *the* tree, not just one of the innumerable 
trees in the forest). In case this tree has been chopped already, or simply not popped - there are two other such trees, one as 
s 2w 6s 4e 4s from the same place, and also somewhere north of the river, like s 3e 2n 5e. Chop it down, get the wood, bring it 
back to Vig, and collect the reward money. One tree is s2 e s2 e s e 2s. Just a small warning: the Dense Forest is a maze (i.e. 
if you go east from tree, then west, there's no guarantee that you'll wind up where you started). If you need to get out of it in 
a hurry, spam north/west and type 'exits' after each step - to see where the exit out to the trail is (this works during the day 
only though). In this forest there are 3 huge black wolves, so it's kinda dangerous for low level characters.
achievement: You provided just the right kind of wood to Vig the smelter.

location: Alkarambar (temple east of the ruined causeway east of Tharbad).
objective: Locate the acolyte who was travelling to Isengard
description:
Amanrandil is troubled. Several months ago he sent his strongest follower on a quest. A large pack of wolves and wargs had gathered
near Moria and the follower was dispatched on an urgent mission to travel to Isengard and warn Lord Saruman of this dire news. 
The acolyte did not return and nothing has been heard of him. Amanrandil and his remaining followers must guard the sanctuary and
cannot venture out to look for their lost friend. If I could find what happened to the acolyte it would surely set Amanrandil's 
mind at rest.

The acolyte's diary confirmed Amanrandil's worst fears. The missing Daedeltir perished during his mission and will never return 
to join the prayers at Alkarambar. With the fate of the acolyte confirmed Amanrandil and his followers can pray for his spirit 
to rest.
walkthrough:
This quest will trigger when a player enters Amanrandil's room - usually when Amanrandil is waiting in the cubicle between speeches. 
He will give a speech about how he sent a follower on an errand, and the follower never returned. Amanrandil will be happy when 
you find the diary of his follower and deliver it back to him. The diary loads either in the belt pouch worn by Wyrdda; animist 
or the twisted beast in Wulfston (Broggha's village); in the pouch worn by the orkish chieftain in Dunland or the pouch worn by
his shaman Mordrath and possibly more.
achievement: You retrieved the diary of Amanrandil's emissary, who perished on the way from Isengard.

objective: Seek the book of Kormanolė in Ost-in-Edhil
description:
Long and with sad voices have the Elves remembered the events of Ost-in-Edhil. It was here that the elven smiths, chief of which
was Celebrimbor, forged mighty rings of power. However, unknown to them was the fact that Annatar, who assisted them in this, was 
none other than Sauron, servant of Morgoth. Long have the mysteries of these ruins intrigued me. While I was in Imladris, I inquired
about the once mighty citadel to Elrond himself. Elrond elaborated on the story of Ost-in-Edhil and admitted to concern about someone
seeking the knowledge hidden therein. He asked for my assistance in this matter and I accepted to explore the ruins in search of 
the Book of Kormanolė, written by Celebrimbor and holding the knowledge required to forged the mighty rings of yesteryear. To aid
me in this quest he provided me with an ancient key attuned to the book, but magically prepared so that, should I be unsuccessful,
it decay lest it falls in the hands of the Enemy. He also suggested I seek an Elf by the name of Maranwė who is as old as the city
itself and knows its secrets like no other.

I read the book and a gemstone of exquisite beauty was imprinted on my mind. I seem to recall a gemstone whose hardness and rare 
blue transparency give off a vitreous luster, a gemstone whose deep green colour is cast upon its surroundings when touched by 
illumination, and a gemstone whose fiery blue glow emanates from deep within.

I entered the ruins of Ost-in-Edhil from the north and sought out Maranwė. I found him wandering the ruins and, upon my inquiry, 
shared with me the existence of an inner chamber. A place in which only the most venerable amongst the Noldor would enter, and 
those properly recognized as their true friends. He told me they were identified by using a bracelet given to them by the Elves. 
I pondered on his advice and continued my exploration of the ruins. I found two obsessed Men, excavating the ruins. They asked 
for my help in recovering a book. I assumed their presence there was likely the source of Elrond's concern. Upon finding the Book 
of Kormanolė hidden in one of the upper chambers, I proceeded to separate myself from the excavators and, eventually, chose to
collect my reward. Was it the wisest choice? I guess in time I will figure it out.

Walkthrough:
Both darkies and whities can solve this quest, thus I will write solutions for both sides. Whities get the quest from Elrond, 
darkies from the BN Sage: ask them about 'Ost-in-Edhil' (not case-sensitive). You can ask them in any language, but Elrond doesn't
understand Westron well, as well as the Sage doesn't speak Orkish. So, if you speak Sindarin/Morbeth well, ask in these languages. 
They will start to talk if no one is solving this quest at the same time (if they don't it means someone is solving it already, 
just wait a bit), and then they will give you a key. Then go to the castle in Ost-in-Edhil and find the tower in the center of it.
Beware: there are many of different DTs in the area - the eastern part of the zone is 4 DTs, 3 of them are timed ones (slowly drag
you to the east; can stay in room aprox.13 sec); vines trap you and slowly kill (considered DTdeath though) - but you can kill 
vines of course, like hero level needed; n and e from the mother eagle on the top of tower are falls (noflee). At the bottom of 
the tower there is a door which can be opened only with an amethyst: type 'put amethyst inset'. To get it back later, 'get amethyst 
inset'. Wait till the door opens and proceed n. You can get the gem back (as both close and open are delayed), but then you will be
stuck inside - so be sure that you know how to get away via underwater. Here starts a noport area. In the center of this hidden 
square is one more instant DT. Somewhere in this area loads hidden main quest item - Book of Kormanolė. There are four possible load
spots. 2n 3e n and s; 2n 3w n and s. Type 'reveal book' to find the book. There are 2 excavators in this area, and they will ask you
to give them the book: don't - they are minions of Saruman. If you give them the book, they will reward you with a whole 2 gold, 
give you a 'treasure map' leading to DT, and disappear (no way to track, kill and get the book back). Then the quest divides into 
two parts: either bring the book and the key back to Elrond or the Sage and get your reward (from Elrond - silver-leaf brooch; 
from the Sage - around 20 gold), or claim the book and forge a ring.
  If you decide to forge, in the northern part of the square is the entrance to the underground part. There live several bats and
4 scaled guardians. These mobs instafollow, call each other, instahit, choose random targets and can instaheal themselves for like 
1/3 HPs. So: at least 1 buffer and 2 nukers need to kill them. Guardians can't follow further north than 2s from the entrance, and 
also to Gem/Glass/etc -works (max w and max e rooms), so rest there after each one is killed. First buffer enters, guardians hit 
him, then casters enter, nuke one dead and leave n, then only buffer flees. Have swim off while doing guardians, otherwise you 
can flee into water (central room); 2n from it is instant DT, and as one who flees from guardians will spam n to reach safe room, 
it can end in DT here. Though, if someone dies here, their corpse will be recoverable: current will drag it southwards, away from 
the DT. Before you fight, unfollow everyone in case you flee. You don't want to meet up after flee and lead each other onto the the 
collapsing bridges. After you kill first, go 2e one by one - otherwise bridge will collapse under your feet, throwing you into the 
current below. Kill the second guardian (now safe room ne from it), get full, then someone must lure guardians from the central 
room - nuke them dead too. Then find the golden band (in each room in this area - random too), it is sometimes hidden, sometimes 
just lies on the ground.
  The level is symmetrical here:

       !
      S*=*S
       +@+
      S*=*S

    ! is where you enter
    = is collapsing bridge
    S are safe rooms
    * are Coruscate Hall
    + are rooms with a single guardian
    @ has 2 guardians and the DT to north.

  Central room is the start of the noboat current. 2n from this room is a DT; some s/d (follow current) - underwater room where 
in the skeleton loads a hammer which helps to fix your armour (even fine/shining!) as a whetstone fixes weapons. All swim on. One
(not the leader) must wear a harness (on chain in room 1w from central). He must enter the central room and open silverpanel. It 
is a delayed door in a room with the current, but the harness will keep him there while he opens the door. When the door is open, 
remove harness, narrate for others to come, and quickly go d. Wait till water goes away and metaldoor opens, then go 2w to the 
noldor statues. Btw, you cant remove the harness while fighting, and cant flee either - so dont wear it while mobs are alive, and
try not to be caught by opposite side players. You can not forge a ring by your own choice. At one time one ring can be forged only; 
which one exactly is written in the book. Ring must be forged from the band and some gem. There are five types of jewelled rings. 
The book can give you a hint - which ring can be created on the current repop: it's the colour of the gem.

-Red glow = ruby
-Maroon = garnet 
-Hard and rare blue = topaz 
-Fiery blue = opal
-Deep green = emerald 

  These rings are considered powerrings, and can not be worn at the same time as old powerrings (ruby/iron/copper/root). To forge 
a ring rest full, and try to pass statues. The higher your will, the higher the chance you have (no alignment involved though). 
If you fail - just rest full and try again (more chance to pass with full stats). Noldor can pass statues without any problems; 
Unqalome bracelets can help non-noldor to pass. If you are neither Noldo, nor know the Unqa zone to get a bracelet, get a dispeller 
here: statues are not alive (not mobs but items, in MUME terms), they don't block entrance themselves - their magic does. With no 
dispeller, just try to walk in (sometimes takes an hour RL or more). Once you are in, wield the band, hold the gem (or vise versa) 
and 'forge ring'.
  Forging a ring is a delayed action. If you are interrupted while doing it, or you interrupt it yourself, the ring and the gem 
disintegrate. If you have a wound that bleeds on a tick, it will interrupt forging also. Thus make sure you don't have any kind 
of wounds (it is rare, but has happens that unbound light wound becomes deep). Once you leave the zone all mobs repop straight away. 
  Some more notes: 
-Only the person who read the book can forge. The knowledge decays so you can only do it for a limited (random) period of time 
after. Don't know how long exactly but sometimes 2 RL days is too long, and sometimes a RL week is ok.
-After crafting 50 jewelled rings, you can choose epithet 'Ring-maker'.
-To use the cross-pein hammer you must make a camp fire, hold the hammer, remove armour then 'use hammer <armour>'. Cant repair 
mithril armour

Complete list of "gem - effect".
    red ruby - manaregen +4, affects you by 'lethargy' when you remove it (slows manaregen 5 ticks)
    topaz    - +2str once per day, affects you by 'tiredness' when you remove it (-1.5 moveregen 5 ticks)
    garnet   - cure critic 3x per day, affects you by 'hagardness' when you remove it (-5 ob)
    opal     - scouting ring, allows you to search adjacent rooms for enemies, blinds you at the beginnings of next 6 ticks when you remove it; to use it - 'look "exit"'
    emerald  - remove poison, affects you by 1-2 random poisons when you remove it instantly (unless you save - thus orcs can get no poison at all)
reward: brooch from Elrond, gold from Sage or jewelled ring.
achievement:
You have forged <amount> jewelled rings with four different varieties of gem stone.
  </amount></armour>

objective: Collaborate with Maranwe to enhance your focus
description:
Having conversed with Ciryariel, she revealed an opportunity to further enhance my focus through the ancient art of Noldorin 
craftsmanship. Ciryariel imparted that Maranwė, a skilled artisan with knowledge harkening back to the days of Fėanor, could teach 
me the ways of refining my focus. Maranwė was said to be near the ruins of Ost-in-Edhil, and Ciryariel suggested seeking him out.

Maranwė greeted me warmly in Ost-in-Edhil, acknowledging that it was always good to see one of the Noldo. He mentioned that few 
of our kind had passed that way since the days of Celebrimbor. He sensed that I had received the blessing of the Valar and revealed 
a secretive Noldor skill to enhance my focus. He instructed me to fetch a silver filigree and a bar of gold, urging me to search 
the old places of power for the required materials.

Under Maranwė's guidance, I melted a gold bar in the forge, carefully applying the provided tools. Following precise instructions, 
I embedded a filigree, infused the object with the power of the Valar, and successfully upgraded it to accept a minor gem, earning 
the achievement of mastering the Noldor's ancient crafting skill
walkthrough: Find a broken filigree at deep inside OiE, it loads same place of cross-pein hammer (no need for cross-pein hammer) inthe skeleton. Then bring broken filigree to Ecthelion, then type 'mend filigree' to get silver filigree. A bar of gold is also needed, you can buy it in shops. After that go find Maranwe near OiE and give him a bar of gold and a silver filigree then follow him to his chamber. Before entering the chamber abandon mount, order charmies sleep, drop everyone - only you can follow Maranwe in the chamber. In the chamber type 'forge "focus"' to add filigree to the focus, creating extra slot and getting and a chievement. Go to jeweller to embed item to focus, which shall be only a minor gem. Reward: extra slot in focus
achievement: You have used the ancient skill of the Noldor to enhance your focus.

location: Elven village n of Road to Grey Havens, The Refuge
objective: Learn the secrets of the walking herblore
description:
Aldereon the wise knows the secret to create a potion to restore my energy quicker. He is willing to share this secret in return
for a favour from me - he has several letters addressed to other wise people throughout Arda and I must deliver them for him. 
Fortified with a sample of his brew I'm ready to set out on this adventure.

Should I forget who the letter is for, Aldereon has also written the recipient on the envelope. If I lose a letter, he said he'd
write a new one if I ask him about the lost letter.

With the favour completed, Alderon was true to his word: I will now be able to brew the walking potion before I set out on long 
journeys. I recorded the potion components in my herblore journal so that I won't forget it.
walkthrough: Ask Aldereon 'herblore' and he will ask you to deliver letters (around 5 for level 1 to more than 15 for high-level) to his friends. The higher your level is, the farther away you will have to travel to meet the mobs. It is better to do this quest at the level one: then Aldereon will ask you to visit mobs in nearby cities. Legends very often are forced to travel to Rivendell. Other recipients for his letters are: the Old Wise Hobbit (not far east from Aldereon, but you have to swim across a small lake), various guildmasters in most cities, and various hermits who live in seldom visited places in Arda. The GH hermit lives 1 zone w from Aldereon, the Shire hermit - some w and n from Mishel Delving, the Fornost one - 10s 3e d 2s from the gates, the Greenway one - s max e s e open bush e from the Ancient Wall along the Greenway. Reward: Walking herblore, 200 xp per your level for (after level 25 5000 xp) each letter.
achievement: You have delivered lots of letters from and to Aldereon, and learned the secret of preparing walking potions.

objective: Aid Angrim's ghost in fulfilling his oath
description:
It was at an abandoned watch tower in the Weather Hills that I ran into a shadow coalescing into the shape of a young soldier. He
was wearing the garb akin to that of the Dśnedain of Fornost and spoke of an oath to his betrothed, Sulien. He was surprisingly 
friendly and asked that I help him find his love.

I wandered about with Angrim's ghost in tow until we came upon the ghost of Sulien. Angrim and Sulien cried out when they saw 
each other; but it was then clear that they were both under the spell of an evil sorcerer. The ghost of the evil sorcerer, Halamor,
then revealed himself and a battle erupted between us where Angrim and I found victory. Halamor's death freed Angrim and Sulien 
from the evil sorcery that bound them, and Angrim managed to fulfill his oath.
walkthrough:
Angrim's ghost will follow you when you enter his room. Lead him to the Fallen Inn, some ws from Angrim's ghost. Go nu from front 
door and help Angrim's ghost to kill Halamor's ghost. After killing the ghost, both Angrim and Sulien ghosts disappear.
achievement: You have aided Angrim's ghost in fulfilling his oath.

objective: Araduin will point me to quests around Bree-land
description:
In the middle of Bree, I came across a weathered and grizzled ranger. After telling me about his extensive travels, including to 
Elvish lands to the east, and Dwarvish caves to the west, he talked about how Bree pulled him in, with an abundance of opportunity 
for the willing adventurer. He told me that I could come to him when I needed work in the city, and he would point me toward it.

The ranger told me that I have served Bree well, and wishes me success in my adventures.
walkthrough: Araduin will point out quests that are available around Bree. Return to him after finishing all of them for the Achievement.
achievement: You helped Araduin, a ranger in Bree, with many tasks around town.

objective: Find the missing delivery of arrowheads
description:
The skilled fletcher in Bree asked me to look into why an expected shipment of arrowheads had not arrived yet. She said that Olly,
the proprietor of Olly's Tavern in Fornost, was in charge of facilitating the shipment.

I need to speak with Olly, the proprieter of Olly's Tavern, in Fornost, and ask him about the arrowheads.
walkthrough:
The skilled fletcher wants you to visit Olly in Fornost and ask him about the arrowheads delivery. Ask Olly 'arrowhead' Olly will
send you to a Manthor's tower, a merchant that trades in weapons. The tower is located about halfway between Fornost and Bree, 
east of the Road to Fornost. When you enter the tower Manthor will talk about his business. Ask Manthor about 'arrowhead' when 
he's done talking to you. Be prepared for for a fight! If you win, he will either give you the map or drop the map to the arrowheads.
Then hold the map and 'look map' to get a general idea of where the arrowheads are hidden. Then with the map in your inventory, 
type 'search'. This will let you know what direction you need to head to find the arrowheads. If you are in the correct room, 
'search' will reveal a bag full of leaf-shaped arrowheads. Take this bag back to Bree and give it to the skilled fletcher.
reward: a quiver of 20 leaf-shaped arrows (pre-enchanted), 5000 xp
achievement: The skilled fletcher in Bree gave me a quiver of leaf-shaped arrows.

location: nw Forlond, Mystical Ring; for rod: Roadside Alehouse, Sheperdess' Home
objective: Find the entrance to the tomb of Azaghal
description:
I found an elven shepherdess who told me of the battle of Nirnaeth Arnoediad where many heroes fought to rid Arda of Morgoth and 
his minions. Many mighty lords fell in this battle such as Fingon the Noldo, Huor of Dor-lómin, and Azaghāl of Belegost. When she
finished her tale she gave me an ancient oaken rod and mentioned she found it in the hills to the southwest. Perhaps I will find 
more there.

I used the ancient oaken rod to solve the mystery of the mystical stone ring and unlock the tomb of Azaghāl, Lord of Belegost. 
I entered the tomb, navigated my way around the traps and stone statues, and found my way to his burial chamber.
walkthrough:
First you need to receive the oaken rod from either the young Dwarf or the Shepherdess (just enter their rooms, and: ask the dwarf
'Unnumbered Tears', or ask the elf 'Nirnaeth Arnoediad'). Listen to the long story, after that one of them will take the rod from 
a sack and give it to you (though, it loads rarely, with a chance of like 10-15% per zonerepop).  Go to the mystical rings some 
sw of the Shepherdess and look at the glyphs on the rod. There are seven different types of glyphs on the rod, and the mystical 
rings consist of seven stones with different paintings. Now simply place the rod (ex. "put rod wedding") in the right stone and 
in the right order. Here is a list of glyphs vs. stone paintings. 

   Mistletoe - Wedding
   Tree - Hunt
   Flame - Battle
   Cloud - River
   Star - Mountain
   Harp - Feast
   Crown - Funeral

More info under Strategy.
reward: Large visored helmet, full chain mail set, battle axe, 2H axe and sometimes metal breastplate.
achievement: You have seen the dwarven burial chambers underneath the mystical stone ring.

objective: Recover a bandit's note for a hunter in the Tower Hills
walkthrough:
After completing quest 'Snake hunt' and 'Rat infestation' the hunter will ask you to help out with bandits. Nod when asked and 
head to the Plateau near the road to Grey Havens. Kill a bandit, loot the crumpled, mud-smeared piece of paper and bring it back 
to the hunter.
achievement: You aided a hunter in keeping the bandits of the Tower Hills at bay.

objective: Deliver a warning to the Fornost barman
description:
I was given a letter by the barman in Bree at the Prancing Pony Lounge. He wanted me to warn the barman in Fornost at the Crown 
of Arnor Inn about a shady wine merchant that was travelling there. The wine merchant hadn't paid his bar tab in Bree and wanted
to save the Fornost barman from the same treachery.

The barman of the Crown of Arnor Inn was very thankful that I was able to deliver the letter before the arrival of the scandalous
wine merchant.
walkthrough:
After entering the Lounge, the barman will ask if you have a moment. Say 'yes' and then you will be asked to bring a letter to 
the barman in Fornost. The barman is located in the Dining Hall of the Crown. Take the letter to Fornost to finish the quest. 
The letter is no-rent/sell.
reward: a map of Fornost, 1000 xp and 500 tps
achievement: You warned the Fornost barman to be wary of the crooked wine merchant.

objective: Bring Clint a beer and recover his two-handed axe
description:
It was in Bree that I met a small dwarf with a red nose who exclaimed that nearly all of his possessions were stolen by a band of
smugglers. Indeed, pretty much all he had left were his blue clothes! He requested that I fetch him a beer and recover his two-
handed axe. If so, he would then go with me to the end of the world.

I gave Clint a beer and found his two-handed axe to much joy on his end. He followed me and said that we had better be off on an 
adventure!
walkthrough:
To start this quest you need to complete some other quests in Bree before. Find Clint and give him a bottle of beer and a two-
handed axe. Clint wanders around Bree, look around to find him.
reward: Clint. He follows you around like mercenary and assists in fights. Also you can ask him to bash doors, must use exact door name for it.
achievement: You were nice to Clint the Dwarf and recovered his axe.

objective: Deliver some baneberries to Weathertop
walkthrough:
First find some baneberries. They load in different places (look under Herbs). Torc/bn can buy baneberries also from DG. Have 
baneberries in your inventory and enter the Necromancer's room. He will snatch the berries from you and give 6 gold in return. 
He also offers you to read a book. Ask him 'read book' and he will give you libram.
achievement: You delivered some baneberries to Weathertop and earned Karōlck's favor.

objective: Eliminate the Bree smuggler threat once and for all
description:
Word has reached the ear of the ranger in Bree about the suspected smuggler camps south of Bree. His intent is clear: to eliminate
the threat they pose once and for all!

The ranger in Bree had been troubled by the increasing smuggling activities south of town, all believed to be orchestrated by the 
notorious Big John. I ventured to Big John's hideout, where, after a fierce and bloody battle, I emerged victorious and claimed 
the ring he wore as proof of his downfall.

Upon returning to Bree, the ranger was relieved to hear of Big John's demise and rewarded me with a powerful crossbow and bolts 
for my bravery. The smuggling threat to Bree is no more, but the ranger warns that vigilance must remain, for lawlessness is never
far from Bree's borders.
walkthrough:
A grizzled old ranger lives in the White Timber House in northern Bree. Say 'yes', when he asks if you "Care to hear what's been 
stirring up?" After that he offers you a mission to bring Big John to justice, say 'yes' again and head out to kill Big John. 
He's located south of Bree in the middle of the Greenway. Kill him, loot the orante ring and bring it back to the ranger.
reward: 5000 xp (2500 xp after), crossbow (max-white enchant), bolt-case (7 random bolts)
achievement: You have helped the Bree ranger eliminate the smuggler threat once and for all.

objective: Follow Olly's information along the Ruined King's Road
description:
I paid Olly within his tavern for some information to reach the Black Dagger Guild. I was to head out through the palisade gate 
and follow the Ruined King's Road until I found a stone with a black dagger painted on it. Upon finding the stone, I was to head 
north until I reached a ruined house where I was to open the hiddenrock, head down into the ruin, and then knock to gain access.

I seem to have forgotten the password to enter and should return to Olly if I want to return to the Black Dagger Guild.

I found the Black Dagger Guild and dealt with the worst robbers of Fornost within their secret hide-out.
walkthrough:
Give Olly 2*(your level) silver/celeb coins and he will tell you the password for the Black Dagger Guild. Then from the w gates
of Fornost go n 4w open hiddenrock d; call and say the password after the guildmaster's request.
achievement: You have dealt with the worst robbers of Fornost and visited their secret hide-out.

objective: Slay the beast described to you by Beriagon the hunter
description:
Beriagon the hunter in Bree told me of a dark wolf filled with evil like the stories of Carcharoth. This creature recently killed
a young ranger who was traveling from the Sarn Ford. He asked me to travel fifty miles south of Bree, near a toppled statue alongside 
the road, and find and kill the creature so it menaces travellers no more.

I killed a werewolf and returned to Beriagon with the news. He was grateful, but very concerned to see such an evil creature this 
far west.
walkthrough:
Last animal Beriagon the hunter asks you to put down is the dark werewolf. Dark werewolf is is located in Greenway, head west on 
road from toppled statue until hidden exit ferns. As you kill them, this quest automatically reports it back to the quest giver 
for you. Report back to the hunter.
achievement: You have slain the werewolf along the path to the Sarn Ford.

location: Rivendell, The Great Library; s of Brolg Tower, Sleeping Chamber
objective: Brave the darkness of the tomb
description: Whitie quest: I was wandering through Rivendell when Erestor stopped me. He mentioned that I had found an old battle-standard, a flag from the old castle that used to be governed by a noble lord. He sadly explain how the noble lord's tomb had been desecrated after the castle fell and said that the old grave would most likely ridden by evil. He claimed that he had placed the path through the tomb in my mind and briefly said something around 'pillars' that might save me. I remember the path through the darkness of the tomb. I found the tomb, unravelled the secrets of the orkish battle-standard, and defeated the darkness within. Darkie quest: Mrak was delighted when I returned to him with Brolg's battle-standard. He spoke of an ancient lord's tomb with a hidden treasure. He said that the guards defending the tomb would be out of control, and that something around 'pillars' might save me. He claimed that he placed the path through the tomb in my mind. I remember the path through the darkness of the tomb. I found the tomb, unravelled the secrets of the orkish battle-standard, and defeated the darkness within.
walkthrough: To start this it, kill Brolg the Orkish Shaman, who resides in the tower on the Ancient Broken Road. Word of warning:when he gets to bad, he will flee and recall away. You can find him w s 3w s 2w 2n open rockface 2e n from outside the tower door. When he is here, he will summon up to two dark wraiths if you give him a chance. Whitie quest: Kill him, and loot his belt pouch and his orkish battle-standard. Loot the tarnished silver key from the belt pouch, and take the orkish battle-standard to Erestor in Rivendell. Erestor will ask for the battle-standard - give it to him, and listen to what he has to say. He will give you the quest. Darkie quest: Bring orkish battle-standard to Mrak, the orkish shaman. Mrak is found in w s w 5s 3e d e. Give starndard and listen him to get the quest. Now, go to the hidden 'tombstone', which is w s w 3s 6e s from outside the Brolg Tower door. Down from here are two stone statues, a stone beast, a glowing spirit, and two dark wraiths. Kill them all. To the north is a secret exit: 'pillars', and behind it are a ghost and another glowing spirit. Kill them and the quest is completed. Use the tarnished silver key from Brolg to unlock and open the chest in the main room, and loot it. Note: to enter the tomb you need the person on quest ("keeper of knowledge bestowed by Erestor"), bless and good align. Darkies just need the quest. Without it you will get some muddled damage and be returned to the room up from the 'tombstone'.
reward: 3 gold, citrine, longsword, metal wall shield. In the skeleton: metal set, a gem-inlaid knife, two gold rings and a silvery crown.
achievement: You braved darkness by unravelling the secrets of the orkish battle-standard.

objective: Return to Bruzhor with the goblin chieftain's head
description:
Bruzhor the Olog-hai told me of a goblin tribe that had forgotten its tribute obligations to Dol Guldur. This tribe had a new 
chieftain who believed himself strong enough to resist. Even worse, he was attacking other orc tribes in the region and hurting 
the war effort. Bruzhor wanted this chieftain dead, such that the tribe would follow the orders from the Lord of Dol Guldur once
again.

Bruzhor said to head east to find the tribe and to bring back the goblin chieftain's head.

I found and killed the goblin tribe's chieftain and brought his head back to Bruzhor as ordered. Bruzhor thanked me for taking 
care of the little maggot and gave me a reward.
walkthrough:
Bruzhor the Olog-hai wants you to bring him the head of a goblin chieftain who believed himself strong enough to resist him. Bhogh 
lives in the nearby tunnels, kill and decap him for his head. Bring it back to Bruzhor for a reward.
achievement: You reminded the goblins of the Misty Mountains to obey the Lord of Dol Guldur.

location: Black Hill Village, Garden behind a Stable
objective: Help Ellie find her doll
description:
Following a cobblestone path within the Black Hill village that led to the garden behind a stable, I met a young girl with braided
ponytails named Ellie. The freckled girl was sobbing over a doll. Ellie explained to me that her doll was hidden in a cellar by a 
boy named Arnie. She then begged for my assistance, being afraid to enter the cellar alone. Ellie was so upset, with tears in her
eyes, that I decided to help her recover her lost doll and followed her to lead the way!

Ellie knew the way to the cellar that needed to be searched, so I followed her quickly hoping she would settle down. She led me 
through the stables, the market square, next into the common room of The Foaming Mug, and finally into the kitchen to the cellar 
door. I accompanied her down into the dark and cramped cellar, ready to protect her if neccessary! Ellie's mood became more frantic 
as I searched. Finally, I had found the ragged old doll! After I gave her the doll, she hugged me tightly and even called me a hero! 
I followed Ellie back to the garden behind a stable to ensure she arrived safely, and then we parted ways.
walkthrough:
Ellie can be found 2e from Black Hill Market Square. Say yes if she asks if you would go with her to the Tavern cellar. Follow 
Ellie when asked and she leads you in there. 'Reveal doll' and give it back to Ellie.
achievement: You found Ellie's doll and returned it to her.

location: Elven Chief's House (north of the Road to Grey Havens, west of Aldereon village).
objective: Recover the stolen barrel of wine and return it
description:
The elven chief is a connoisseur of fine wines, some say his collection of vintage wines is the greatest of any west of the elven
homes at Rivendell, at least thats what the chief told me. News of his valuable cellar stock must have reached the wrong people 
and, while he was visiting relatives, brigands broke in and stole barrels of his wine. Rumours abound that the perpetrators are 
hiding out in a cave a some miles west of the village.

With the barrel of wine returned, the elven chief broke the seal and toasted my good health. Tasting that outstanding vintage again 
has brought back many happy memories for the old chief.
walkthrough:
Ask the chief of this village about 'wine'. He will tell you about his favourite wine, Old Winyard. If the quest is available, he 
will inform you that his last barrel of Old Winyard is gone. In this case, ask him about the 'barrel', and he will tell you the 
story of how it was stolen. There is a bandit hideout to the northeast where you can find 'A small ironbound barrel made of fine 
oak'. Bring thr barrel back to the chief. Thieves and brigands in the room will prevent you from taking it, so wait for them to 
leave, or kill them.
reward: An exquisite wine glass full of wine, +sindarin
achievement: You have successfully returned the stolen barrel of wine to the elven chief.

location: ABR, Stone Courtyard (e from Weatherworn Guard Cave entrance)
objective: Return the heirlooms of Lorien to the elven trader
description:
I found an elven trader who was recovering from a battle that happened near the Dśnadan camp along the ancient broken road. He 
spoke of an elven caravan that carried chests and passengers between Imladris and Lórien that was assaulted by Olog-hai, breaking 
the combined forces of the Dśnadan and Elves that were guarding it. Many of the innocent passengers were slaughtered and the 
chests that the caravan carried were stolen.

He asked me to find a missing key; mentioning that a Dśnadan had picked it up during the battle but had not been seen since. I was 
to use the key and retrieve any remaining elven heirlooms from the stolen chests in return for favor with the Golden Wood.

I found the key to the elven chests and returned a precious heirloom of the Golden Wood to the elven trader.
walkthrough:
Elven heirlooms are loaded in 4 different chests in ABR. Key for chest loads on wild-eyed man in Osbert's Camp which is located in 
the middle of ABR. Go 4s e from the Covered Bridge over a Confluence, kill the guard, 2 dogs and 2 smugglers there; they guard the 
exit down. Wild-eyed man is locked in there.
Theres 3 ways to get key: 
-Slap the man when he chokes after you enter the room (he drops the key); 
-Kill and butcher the man (key is in the corpse); 
-Kill and let charmies butcher the man (key is in the corpse).
One chest is located in the Leader's Bedroom, just u w 2s e n from the wild-eye man. Kill Osbert to open the chest. 
Second chest is in the Chieftain's Throneroom, kill Bhogh to open the chest.
Third chest is in the Natural Throne, 2 huge trolls and stoine troll mother and open the chest. 
Fourth chest is in the Hall of the Giants, kill Gukk to open the chest.
reward: Elven trader restocks his herbal shop.
achievement: You returned a precious heirloom of the Golden Wood to the elven trader.

location: The Elven Scouts's Hideout (from ABR thornbushes s max e s w, call or pick/open hillside); Rivendell
objective: Deliver important information to Elrond at Imladris
description:
I found myself in the lands south of the River Bruinen, in the land near the camps of the Ohurk-uai orcs led by the fearsome shaman 
Brolg. I recalled the existence of a -scouting- outpost by a high hill, south of a small stream. I reached the hill and called 
near a door cleverly camouflaged on the hillside. In this hideout I met two of Elrond's scouts who asked me if I was headed to 
Imladris. I shared with them my intention to reach the fair valley of Rivendell. One of them asked me to take a letter on their 
behalf to Elrond, master of Imladris. I agreed to serve as courier for these valiant scouts.

I reached the moors that surround the hidden entrance to Rivendell. I found my way into the valley protected by the power of Elrond 
Half-Elven. I quickly reached the entrance to the Last Homely Home and sought out Elrond. He received the letter and asked me to 
join him as he read the report sent to him by his scouts. It turned out to be important information as to the movement of orkish
troops in the neighbouring lands. Grateful for the my willingness to face the dangers that carrying this message entailed, Elrond 
proceeded to reward me generously.
walkthrough: Upon entering their hidden camp, they may start talking - nod when they ask if you are willing to help, and they will give you a letter. Take this letter to Elrond, who will reward you. The amount of experience you receive will get smaller each time you complete this quest. Tarkhnarb orcs can kill scouts and bring letter to Great Goblin. Reward: 2,5k xp, 3 gold. Reward: xp and either 5 gold, or 2 gold + miruvor.
reward: xp and either 5 gold, or 2 gold + miruvor.
achievement:
You delivered to Elrond a letter from his scouts with important information about the movements of orc forces.
You intercepted an important letter for Elrond from his scouts and delivered it to the Great Goblin.

location: s, 2w, 6s, w, 3s from 'Bridge before Grey Havens', Airy House
objective: Find out why the weaver's shipments of dye stopped
description:
I encountered an extremely old elven weaver a short distance south of Harlond, who lamented of the fact that she had stopped 
receiving her regular shipments of a very special dye. Without it, she is no longer able to produce the cloth used in a certain 
type of cloak that is reputed to make the wearer all but invisible in the woods. I assured her that I would immediately seek out
the dwarf who normally supplied her dye to determine the cause of the problem.

I managed to locate the dwarven dye-maker who crafts the special dye for the weaver. Further, I was intrumental in assisting him 
to retrieve a certain key ingredient for the mixture. He provided me with a generous supply of the newly brewed dye, which I 
promptly delivered to the weaver. She thanked me profusely for my assistance, as well as gifting me with a few small tokens of 
her esteem.
walkthrough:
The ancient weaver will ask if you would help her, say 'yes'. Then she will send you to retrieve dye from a small mine up north 
near the levee area. Find the dwarven dye-maker and say 'dye', if he asks you if you were sent by that old biddy who makes those 
green cloaks say 'yes'. Complete quest 'A handful of moss' to get the dye. Bring it back to the ancient weaver.
achievement: You fetched a jug of dye, formula no. 58 (forest green), to an elven weaver.

objective: Help young Leonard prepare for his future adventures
description:
West of the path through the Black Hill village stands a simple home where I met a young man named Leonard. He was daydreaming of
adventures in lands far away! Leonard asked if I could help him find equipment that would aid him in his future adventures. 
Leonard offered to share his knowledge he learned from rangers, hunters, and warriors within the village if I aided him.

I wrote down the items he wanted, so that I can scratch them from my list as I deliver them to Leonard...

The young man was so excited when I brought him the items he needed that he exchanged notes of his knowledge with me. Leonard was 
all set for his adventure and I feel that I learnt a lot that will be useful to me!
walkthrough:
Leonard wants your help to gather some equipment for his adventures. If you agree to help he will give u a list of items that he
needs. Some can be found nearby but you can also buy them from shop.
achievement: You aided Leonard in following his dream to become an adventurer.

location: Grey Havens cleric guild, Small Temple
objective: Seek evidence of evil from the Harlond burial mound
description:
I found a slender elf named Filatior performing sacred ceremonies in the Small Temple within Harlond. He told me a frightening 
tale of a burial mound near the city where the dead had awoken and were seeking to harm the living. He asked if I could seek out
this grave for him, and bring me some part of the evil that lurks there. I accepted this task and set out to find this evidence, 
preferably a bone somewhere close to the heart, and return it to him.

Filatior mentioned that the burial mound could be found east of the city by leaving out of the eastern gates and heading north. 
As soon as I had left the road, I needed to turn to the east and travel past a burned-out area in the fields. I was then to 
continue into a swamp and look for a desolate area in the plains several leagues to the northeast. Moving south through some 
boulders I could then find the burial mound to the east.

I found the burial mound and retrieved an bone as evidence for Filator. The acolyte did what he could to drive out the foul magic; 
causing the bone to glow red and crumble into a grey dust. This task left him exhasuted and he lamented being unable to find the 
source of the evil spell. He then rewarded me with a magical weapon left by an old warrior and cast a spell on my to aid me on my
travels.
walkthrough:
Filatior the elven cleric of Harlond is seeking help to kill an evil being in a burial mound east of GH. After agreeing to the 
quest, he will describe the path to this burial mound. Follow the instructions, it is fairly easy (n 6e 5n 2e 2s e from Bridge 
before Grey Havens), kill the skeletons and bring back the rib-bone to him.
reward: 7000 xp, blessing or str, random weapon (enchanted), +sindarin
achievement: You have helped Filatior to destroy evil beings.

objective: Collect the furs and skins for the Bree tanner
description:
I visited a tanner in Bree, and he told me of his desire to create a special cloak with a silvery streak. He learned the pattern
for this cloak during his travels when he visited Elves out east. His last hunter, Darb, succumbed to a rattlesnake bite and died,
and the tanner sought a brave adventurer to acquire the necessary pelts in Darb's stead. He promised to reward me should I succeed.

The master tanner was very pleased to receive the necessary pelts for his new pattern, and gifted me a cloak with with a silvery 
streak. He told me he may need my services again, and to check with him in the future.
walkthrough:
Give fur or pelts to the tanner for money rewards. Do not sell them. However, he also acts as a fur and pelt shop so you can sell
furs and pelts there, but it does not count as progress for the quest line. You need to give the pelts and furs instead. You can 
buy the furs or pelts and turn them in as well. He doesn't care how you get the furs, as long as you turn them in. This is a chain
quest: 2 brown bear furs, then 2 warg furs, then 1 rattlesnake skin, then (lev21) 1 Shire packleader fur.
