reward: 3 gold, brown bottle, a fur-cloak with a silvery streak. 4000 xp.
achievement: You assisted the Bree tanner in creating a fur cloak with a silvery streak.

objective: Bring things to the grimy hill troll to learn to burrow
description:
Under the Warrens, in a grimy little burrow, I found a hill troll who called me a nitwit. He offered to teach me how to burrow in 
return for bringing him some foodstuff.

I have brought a shovel, the corpse of a Stoor child, the corpse of a lones-hare, and the corpse of a large rabbit.

The grimy hill troll ate all the corpses and broke the shovel. He taught me all the fine arts of burrowing, including making a 
hidden door!
walkthrough:
Only hill trolls can take this quest to learn burrow skill. Burrow skill allowes hill trolls to dig burrow in hills, that makes 
one safe room with hidden exit. To learn it, bring shovel, a Stoor child corpse, the corpse of a lones-hare, and the corpse of 
a large rabbit to the grimy hill troll in Warrens.
achievement: You entered a hastily hollowed-out burrow that was carved from a hillside.

location: n of Grey Havens, Dyemaker's Alcove
objective: Locate a rare moss and return with it
description:
While attempting to procure a rare dye to satisfy the needs of an elven weaver, I sought out a dwarf reputed to be capable to 
crafting any dye imaginable. Alas, when I finally located him, he revealed that he was missing one key ingredient to produce the
dye in question, a rare species of dark-green moss. Furthermore, he insisted that he was no longer able to secure more of it, due
to a collapsed bridge. I volunteered at once to restock his supply, whereupon he directed me to proceed west to the river. There 
I am to search out a stump to which I can tie a stout rope. By throwing the rope over a branch on the far side, he claims that I 
will be able to affect a crossing.

I was successful in crossing the treacherous river and managed to locate a small supply of the moss. With it in my possession, 
I returned to the dye-maker. He quickly brewed up a noxious concoction that he insisted was precisely the right shade of green 
desired by the elven weaver. He supplied me with a large jug full of the mixture, along with his heartfelt thanks for my efforts.
walkthrough:
The dye-maker wants you to retrieve a small patch of dark-green moss. You will need a rope to get that moss. One loads in the 
cabinet n e from the dye-maker. Go to 'Cliff's Edge' at the river west from the mines. 'tie rope tree' and then 'throw rope stump' 
until the rope successfully catches the stump. wwn is the moss, take it and bring it to the dye-maker.
reward: 1000 xp, 1 gold and a sealed jug of dye
achievement: You fetched some dark-green moss to a dwarven dye-maker.

location: ABR, Leader's Bedroom; Tharbad, The Illusionist's Laboratory
objective: Bring Osbert's head to the Illusionist of Tharbad
description:
The Illusionist in Tharbad offered me a reward if I could kill Osbert the chief smuggler, and bring his head to her. Osbert had 
killed her twin sister and now she wanted him dead.

She did not know where Osbert lives but it was somewhere to the east.

I killed Osbert the chief smuggler easily and brought back his head to the Illusionist. The Illusionist was overjoyed with her 
sister being avenged, and was clearly impressed by my powers, as rewarded me with precious items.
walkthrough: Kill Osbert in the Bandits Camp in the middle of ABR, butcher him and bring his head to the Illusionist in Tharbad.
achievement: You killed Osbert and avenged the sister of the Illusionist of Tharbad.

objective: Find a lost key in Tharbad
description:
I was interested in mastering a set of skills that are rarely taught openly. I heard rumours that led me to the city of Tharbad 
in search of more learned masters. Once there I was pointed in the direction of an old gentleman who was known by some to teach
these skills.

As I entered his abode, in the rooftops of Tharbad, he glanced my way and maybe he took to liking me, maybe he was testing me. 
He told me a story about his exploits near the city gates, and of a key he lost that opened a warehouse there. He suggested I 
might be capable of finding the key, and if I did so, I was welcome to use it and keep whatever was in the warehouse.

I methodically searched the area around the western gate of Tharbad, even exposing myself at times to the foul waters of the 
Greyflood that turn toxic as they run through the city. Eventually I found a tiny copper key. Taking courage I braved the foul 
waters and entered the warehouse. In there I found a small treasure, which I figured I had earned for my troubles.
walkthrough:
The old man (guildmaster) will ask you to find a key for him. The key is hidden: From where the coach arrives in Tharbad, go all
south, 2 east, open crack, north, 'reveal key'. The old man will have told you that this key was for a warehouse on the southern 
bank of the river, inside the city; he says that he doesn't want to be bothered with this any more, and that if you find the key,
you should use it.
achievement: Following the thief's advice, you found the lost key in Tharbad, and managed to enter to the attic above the warehouse.

objective: Bring Quenaire's letter of introduction to Tethel
description:
After returning the missing book to Quenairė, he become so happy that he promised to write me a letter of recommendation, to be 
delivered to a ranger named Tethel who lived in the outskirts of the Golden Wood. All I needed to do was to ask for the letter 
from Quenairė.

I delivered the letter of recommendation to Tethel. She said that Quenairė's trust speaks highly of me, and let me understand that 
if I wasn't already familiar with the ways of the Golden Wood, she'd help me to visit Lórien.
walkthrough:
After completing quest 'Quenaire's tome' you received letter for Tethel. Bring it back to Tethel, she will say that she has to 
speak to Galadriel and vanish for 24 ticks. Return after 24 ticks and you will be granted limited access to Lorien.
reward: lembas wafers, possibly some miruvor, and a letter of introduction to the elves of Lorien.
achievement: You have been granted an annual entrance to Lorien.

objective: Navigate the glass maze under the Tower of Amon Sul
description:
I found a thick tome titled the Libram of Curaen that was authored by a sage of Arthedain in the year 1311 of the Third Age. The
libram talked about a palantķr and a glass maze that was constructed beneath the Tower of Amon Sūl. I read that a map through the
maze could be stimulated subconciously by reading an example on the following page.

The instructions were to start below the Great Hall. I was then to move "dirs". I would then be on the path.

I found my way down under the Tower of Amon Sūl and successfully navigated my way through the glass maze below the Great Hall.
walkthrough:
As Whitie, to get the book you need to kill the Necromancer; Darkies can kill him too or complete the 'Berries for Karōlck' quest.
To read, hold the book and type "read example". The book gives you 14 dir for the glass maze and the directions are individual.
reward: Quest itself doesnt have direct reward but passing maze leads area where Palantir loads.
achievement: You navigated through the glass maze as described by the Libram of Curaen.

objective: The giant will teach you his baking secrets
description:
I met with a giant and comforted him as he seemed lonely. To my joy he said we could be friends if together we could go in search
of some fresh ingredients for his baking that he so much enjoys. 

We travelled far and wide looking for lots of unusual herbs and spices. Finally, when we had found everything we needed, he called
me <name>-the-winkle and we were firm friends.

He let me ride him to his home in the hills - what a journey that was... Once there we learned how to make bannocks together, I 
wrote the recipe in my herblore journal to remember it, they were delicious!
walkthrough:
Possible load places in the Shire: one room N from Michel Delving fountain; E from Green Dragon in Hobbiton; N from the marketplace
in Dwaling; in Rushey; at "slight depression" (up from the fox hole); NW from Wittforrows and in the Hills of Scary. If you can't
find the giant - ask any mage to locate him ('locate life' spell). He doesn't always load.

  Quest: You must find a lot of herbs and other things and bring them to him. He frequently asks for:

  HONEYCOMB           EGG                 APPLE               SACK OF FLOUR
  STRAWBERRIES        BLUEBERRIES         BLACKBERRIES        BLACKCURRANT
  CINNAMON            VANILLA BEAN        CARDAMOM            JUNIPER BERRIES
  RED ROSE            WHITE ROSE          WATER LILY          HONEYSUCKLE
  FOXGLOVE            FOXTAIL             TARRAGON            THYME
  ROSEMARY            GOOSEGRASS          CLOVER              CLOVES
  SAGE                ATHELAS             MARJORAM            FIGWORT
  GINSENG             COMFREY

Try to find all these things, but if you can't find such rare herbs as foxtail, ginseng and comfrey, don't worry, maybe he won't
ask you for them. Do not crush the plants: sometimes he asks for leaves/flowers, sometimes for the plant itself. When you find 
thegiant, comfort him. Nod after he asks you if you want to help him, and he will start following you. Give him honeycomb, listen 
carefully what he wants and give him herbs. You have a short time to solve his quest - 40-48 MUME hours, so try to have some herbs
ready in your backpack - except for things that are always available in the GH herbalist shop (cinnamon, cloves, vanilla). You can
run to GH with the giant, but he can become moveless soon - in such a case leave him in some safe place (just flee from him), and
return with herbs. After giving him all that he wants, ride him and he takes you to his house near Michel Delving and be happy
listening to him.
This quest is as level-dependant - so if you find him at level 1-5, he will teach you how to cook bannocks just for the honeycomb! 
Legends can be asked for ginseng, comfrey and foxtail - each of these herbs load just in a few places on Arda, so it is almost 
impossible to find them without knowing where they load.
reward: Baker herblore, 1000 xp for every herb he asks
achievement:
You befriended the lonely giant and visited his home in the Hills of Faraway.
  </name>

objective: Help the weaponsmith in Bree recover his lost dagger
description:
As a collector of antique weapons the Bree Weaponsmith was very excited to receive news that a friend of his has found him a 
particularly old and rare dagger. However, when I passed his shop he told me it still hadn't arrived despite it having left 
Fornost many weeks ago. Clearly something had happened to the messenger and I agreed to help out by going looking for the missing
antique blade. He told me to start looking at the Nasty Mewlip Inn where the courier often stopped for a drink.

The ruffian Scarred had the missing dagger in his possession! He and his band of men put up a fight but eventually they were 
defeated. I grabbed the dagger and returned to Bree where the grateful Weaponsmith gave me my reward.
walkthrough:
You will be asked to find and bring the "valuable" rusted dagger - just enter the shop at the proper level. This dagger is held 
by the chief of the ruffians, Scarred, under the bark in a forest some n of Bree. Kill him (or just ask a friend to kill him) and
bring the dagger to the smith. You cannot start the quest after level 9, but if you did it before and leveled since then, the smith 
still gives the reward if you bring him the dagger. Or, if you bring the dagger to the smith without being on the quest (if you 
do this quest second time and/or after level 9), the smith gives you as a reward stone and gold only. The dagger is no-rent/sell.
achievement: You recovered the antique dagger sought by the Bree weaponsmith.

location: Hobbiton, Heldor's Clothes Emporium (2e s from central).
objective: Find and return a lost daughter to her worried father
description:
The poor shopkeeper is in a dilemma. His daughter has gone missing and he wants to search for her, but what if she came home while
he was out looking? The only solution is that I go and look for him. I've been told that she doesn't wander all that far so I had 
better keep to the Shire.

I returned the shopkeeper's daughter to her father safe and well. He was very relieved to see her again and the daughter seemed 
happy to be home. Having spoken to her as we travelled she is a very strong-willed young woman and, knowing what she is like, she 
will undoubtedly go 'exploring' again!
walkthrough:
Shopkeeper will ask you to find his daughter as soon as you enter his shop. Daughter is usually located somewhere in the Shire, 
possible five locations:
-From 'A Spring' in hills of Scary: 2e, open branches, s, 4e, n, w
-From Brandywine Bridge: 7w, 6n, 5e, open exit e, e
-some down from Michel Delving
-From Brandywine Bridge: e, 2s, 2e
-From Tuckborough Market Square: d, w, 2n, open exit d, d 
Just enter her room and she will start following you. Lead her to her father.
achievement: You found the lost daughter of a Shire shopkeeper and brought her home safely.

location: Black Hill Village, Low Stone Cabin
objective: Search for a lost wedding ring in the Tower Hills
description:
After returning to the crippled ranger with Lum's moneybag, he told me another story about Lum's cousin Clem. It appears they 
belong to a family notoriously incapable of holding on to their belongings. And since I had been so helpful to Lum, the ranger
thought that maybe I could help poor Clem too...

The crippled ranger explained how Clem had been deep in a cave, gathering mushrooms, when he lost his wedding ring. The wedding 
ring means a great deal to Clem, as his wife is no longer among the living, and Clem would be grateful to have the ring returned 
to him.

The ranger's knowledge of the way to the cave was clear as day! I was to follow the wagon trail to the south-west, and the valley
lies just on the western side of the trail, a few miles before it merges with the worn trail further south. Clem lost the ring on 
the other side of an underground lake, and I will have to search for the ring in the right place.

Making my way to the tunnel was easy, but once inside I realized how deep underground it went. Deeper within the tunnel was an 
intersection, and from this point one could smell the humidity in the air from the western tunnel. Following the damp and humid 
air deeper into the western tunnel led me to a lake. It was a good thing I knew I had to make my way across it, or I would never 
have tried it.

I will never forget the chill of the water and the gloomy stalactites threatening above! Once I reached the cavern beyond, I could 
instantly tell this was an old meeting place from the litter scattered about the ground. After looking through some of the old 
litter, I began searching around in the dirt. When digging into the ground at a slight impression, my nails and hands covered in 
dirt, I suddenly felt something solid and cold. The ring! Dusting the ring off with the sleeve of my shirt, I slipped it into 
mypocket for safekeeping, and headed back to the village.

The crippled ranger was excited for my return with Clem's old wedding ring and was kind enough to give me a moneybag, a plain 
scarf, and a gold coin to aid in my adventures.
walkthrough:
After completing quest 'Moneybag recovery' ranger will asks you to help him again, after nodding you need to get Lum's cousin 
Clem lost old wedding ring. Its located near Way Station, go ennwssswsw and 'search ring'. Bring it back to ranger for rewards.
achievement: You swam in murky water.

location: Black Hill Village, Black Hill Market Square
objective: Maelton will direct me to quests in the Tower Hills
description:
I found Maelton in the Tower Hills acting as a middleman directing adventurers like myself to villagers in need. He told me to 
seek him out if I ever needed more work around Black Hill Village.

Maelton told me that I had done great work in Black Hill Village and that it was time for me to seek adventures elsewhere. He 
gave me a letter of recommendation and told me to deliver it to his cousin who worked in Bree. In order to reach Bree, I had to 
follow the Road to the Grey Havens east past the Shire until I reached where the Old East Road met the Greenway. Maelton said
that his cousin worked in Bree as a secretary.

I travelled all the way to Bree and found Maelton's cousin. I handed in the letter of recommendation and closed the chapter of 
my story around Black Hill Village.
walkthrough: Upon entering Maelton, the village elder he asks if you will listen to him, say 'yes' and he will tell you how you can come to him and ask about help and quests. After finishing all Tower Hills quests, approach Maelton again and he will offer a small favor and thank you for your help. Say 'yes' and Maelton will hand you over a letter of recommendation. You should bring this letter to the secretary in Bree. Reward: Bree citizenship; hug if you have it
reward: Bree citizenship; hug if you have it
achievement: You travelled all the way to Bree and found Maelton's cousin.

objective: Put a mangy bear near Fornost out of its misery
description:
Beriagon, a hunter based in Bree, has asked me to take down a diseased and dangerous bear, one that has an injured leg from a failed 
trap attempt, and a bad case of mange. The great beast has caused massive damage to barns and livestock, and is unlikely to be able 
to hunt naturally, due to its injury. He advised me that it has been spotted far north of Bree, and might be found in the vicinity 
of a camp site, or a place with human food and detritus.

Beriagon was delighted to hear that I had successfully put down the mangy bear, and assured me that the farmers of Bree-land would 
hear of my brave exploits.
walkthrough:
Beriagon the hunter asks you to kill the mangy bear. The mangy bear loads north of Fornost. As you kill it, this quest automatically 
reports it back to the quest giver for you. You need to return back to the Beriagon to get the next step in the quest chain and say 
'yes' if he asks if you are willing to continue.
achievement: You aided the Bree-land by killing a wounded, and dangerous bear.

objective: Bring the apprentice ore to finish his work
description:
After arriving in Black Hill village, I spotted and approached a well for a much-needed drink. Working nearby, a blacksmith's 
apprentice approached, pleading for help retrieving ore from a nearby mine. I considered the benefitsof befriending a craftsman 
of his trade. He instructed to wield a pick and mine where the mineral veins show the most, and pointed a finger south-east, 
saying, "The mine in mind is just over yonder!"

Actually I think he was a bit more clear than that, now that I think back to the encounter. East along the trail outside the 
village's south gate, I'll find a Hunter's cabin. The mine is close by the cabin, just to the south-east. I need to mine some ore.

After a short venture, I came across the mine and, pick in hand, I went to work! It was a slightly laborious effort, but before 
long I had the ore in hand. The young apprentice was gladdened to have the materials he needed, and rewarded me with a sturdy 
backpack to help me carry my possessions. Lastly, he informed me that his master would happily give me coin for any ore I sell 
at the smithy in the future!
walkthrough: Apprentice needs your help with ore mining. Nod or say yes when he asks for your help. He asks you to bring him ore from the old mine just some se from Black Hill Village. He will give you a pick, a lantern and oil. Mine the ore and bring it back to him. Reward: leather backpack, 1000 xp
achievement: You aided the blacksmith's apprentice in Black Hill village by bringing him ore.

location: Black Hill Village, Low Stone Cabin
objective: Search for a lost moneybag in the dry gulch
description:
At the north side of Black Hill village in the Tower Hills, I met a crippled ranger who was happy to teach me his knowledge of 
the wilderness. The crippled ranger then told a sad tale of Old Lum, an elder of the village, who lost an old moneybag with 
sentimental value while he was gathering berries and roots at the edge of a cliff.

After listening closely to the crippled ranger's tale of Old Lum, I decided to be of service to the crippled ranger and seek to 
retrieve it for Old Lum. The moneybag had fallen off the cliff onto a ledge in a dry gulch, just west of an old tower that stands
in the hills to the south of the village. The ranger said I would probably have to get to the ledge from the bottom of the gulch, 
and that he could teach me the climbing skill, which would likely be needed.

Once I find the ledge, I will have to search for the moneybag.

The well-travelled wagon trail took me along rolling hills covered with wildflowers and grasses, until I came upon hills so barren
that even a weed would have a tough time surviving. It was here that I came upon the dry gulch.

After climbing down a rocky slope toward a dry gulch, I discovered I was going to need more than just wilderness skills here. The 
gulch was infested with snakes! I made it past them and found myself at the bottom of the gulch, below the ledge where the moneybag
landed. My hands and legs were exhausted from the climb, but it was here that I recovered Old Lum's moneybag and promptly returned 
it to the crippled ranger at Black Hill village.
walkthrough:
As you enter crippled ranger house, he will ask your help, nod and again if he asks second time. He wants you to retrive Old Lum's
old moneybag that is lost in the hills. Reach to On a Rocky Shelf and 'search moneybag'. Bring it back to ranger.
achievement: You climbed to high heights.

objective: Help the plump hobbit win top baker at the festival
description:
I ran into a rather plump hobbit female that wanted to win the top baker prize at the local festival within Hobbiton. She gushed
about a particular meat-pie like treat she got from her cousin the tanner in the Woody End Forest. She promised a reward if I were
to bring back more of these savoury treats.

I was pulled into a journey that involved meeting a tanner and venturing into Bree to acquire some savoury dumplings from the 
local baker. I returned to the plump hobbit with the delectable treats and she promptly ate them trying to decipher the recipe. 
She rewarded my efforts with a ticket for a dales-pony from the famous Dwaling stables.
walkthrough:
A plump hobbit female in the A Comfortable Smial in Hobbiton will ask you to bring treats. Complete the Bree baker questand bring
her the dumplings you receive as a reward.
reward: 2000 xp for 4 dumplings, a map of the freehold of the Shire, dales-pony ticket.
achievement: You got a pony for helping the plump hobbit learn how to bake dumplings.

location: Tower Hills, Home of a Pony Breeder
objective: A ponybreeder in the Tower Hills needs aid with a wolf
description:
Whilst venturing through the Tower Hills, I happened across the humble abode of an old pony breeder. Despite a warm welcome, his 
expression belied troubled thoughts, and soon he made his plight known: his prized ponies had been falling prey to a particular 
old, one-eyed wolf. He surmised the beast, addled from long years of predatory life, has permanently fixed its eye upon the 
corralled ponies for an easy meal, and will not stop feeding upon them unless it is slain. He offered what he knew of the wolf: 
first, the tracks always lead to and from the east, and the best way to lure out such a beast was to lay fresh animal meat near 
its den.

Following what the old pony breeder said of the wolf, I quickly picked up its tracks not far to the east of the pony corral. 
Following it further, the tracks became more pronounced; it was time to find the bait. After hunting down some suitable prey and 
butchering it, I made my way to the forest. I found the den shortly after and dropped the meat nearby, retreating a short distance 
behind some brush. Within minutes the beast emerged, salivating from the scent of fresh meat. I quickly learned how ferocious an 
old wolf can be, even in his old age! Luckily, I was able to dispatch the terror and brought its hide back to the pony breeder, 
whom was finally able to rest easy knowing his ponies were now safe.
walkthrough:
As you enter the home of the Pony Breeder, he will start talking about his problem. If he asks if you have a little time to spare,
nod. Then you need to nod again after he asks if you will help him. After that he needs you to get some fresh meat and lure out 
the old wolf. Kill some random animal nearby, butcher and drop the meat sseeenen from the House of Pony Breeder. After the old 
wolf appears, kill him and butcher him for fur. Take the fur to the Pony Breeder to receive rewards.
reward: woollen traveller's cloak, leather saddle, 2 large piece of smoked, cured meat, 1 gold, 2000 xp
achievement: You helped the pony breeder in the Tower Hills with his wolf problem.

objective: Bring raw meat to the Bree baker
description:
The baker in Bree was injured while hunting for fresh meat. He needs pork and venison to make his special meat pies, but is unable
to hunt for it himself. He asked me to bring him pork and venison so that he could continue making meat pies.

The baker was very grateful that I was able to bring him the meat he needed and in return, he rewarded me with a new dumpling that 
he is working on, that is not even for sale yet.
walkthrough:
Say 'yes' after hobbit baker ask if you are interested lending him a hand. Bring him 10 pounds of venison meat and 10 
pounds of pork meat. He will keep track of your progress as you turn meat in. Make sure it's raw meat.
achievement: You have helped the baker in Bree by delivering him meat for his meat pies.

objective: Rescue the ragged-looking hobbit from the Troll Warrens
description:
On my travels I discovered a ragged-looking Stoor within the foul depths of the Troll Warrens. He initially panicked when he saw 
me but quickly regained his composure only to nearly give away our position by expressing his joy. We then proceeded to escape 
from the deep pit.

After we escaped from the Warrens he thanked me and asked me if I could bring him to a Stoor village to the southwest.

I found the village and the ragged-looking hobbit fell to the ground in tears, kissing the earth repeatedly. He then entered his
hobbit hole and returned with some gifts, rewarding me for helping him escape.
walkthrough:
Open the pendoor (24 str needed) in the Warrens or bash the stonedoor and let the hobbit inside follow you. Bring him to the Stoor
village some west of Windswept.
reward: 5 gold, honey-scented cake, amethyst, fishing rod and small jewel-box.
achievement: You rescued a Stoor hobbit from the slave pit in the troll warrens and helped him get home.

objective: Exterminate giant rats in the Tower Hills
description:
Once I returned to the accomplished hunter, he set forth upon me a secondtasking, clearly seeing my potential. He instructed me 
to head north-west to Black Hill Village, then follow the path north out of the village until I came to the farming fields. From
there I would head straight west until I reached the farm that had a barn with a cellar hatch. I was to search down there for the
source of giant rat infestation!

The hunter made it quite clear that I would need the search skill he could teach me if I was to find the locations of the giant 
rats. Perhaps I should be looking in all directions down there to see if anything looks odd about the walls. Three corpses, I 
believe should be enough to show proof that my task was done well.

Following his directions, I came across the farm quite easily. Once down in the hatch, I saw the rats skittering into holes in 
the wall, and promptly searched in those directions. I skilfully uncovered hidden doors that lead me to them, and dispatched them 
all! I brought the corpses back to the accomplished hunter and he rewarded me with a nice pair of boots.
walkthrough:
After completing quest 'Snake hunt', the hunter will ask you to slay rats, nod when asked. Head n through village and there's a 
cellar in the farmhouse. Kill giant rats, take 3 corpses with you and give them to the ranger.
reward: fine pair of soft leather boots, 500 xp
achievement: You aided Black Hill village and the hunter by cleaning out a rat infestation.

objective: Kill a scarred boar that has been plaguing Bree-land
description:
Beriagon, the hunter in Bree, has tasked me with killing  a troublesome boar that has plagued many merchants who bring goods to 
and from the city. He advised me to search wooded areas, closeby and north of Bree, for a boar with large tusks, an agressive 
nature, and scarred skin. He also advised me to bring a group, lest this beast get the best of me!

With the task of putting down the troublesome boar completed, Beriagon thanked me, and was sure that the merchants that pass 
through town would be thrilled to hear about it.
walkthrough:
After Beriagon the hunter talks, 'ask hunter beast'. He wants you to kill a special scarred boar. The boar is NE of Bree, in a 
forest with bats, near the entrance to Scarred. As you kill it, this quest automatically reports it back to the quest giver for 
you. You need to return back to the Beriagon to get the next step in the quest chain and say 'yes' if he asks if you are willing 
to continue.
achievement: You helped the Bree-land by putting down a troublesome boar.

objective: Bring a great pelt to the secretary of Michael Delving
description:
I received an urgent request from the Mayor of the Shire, who sought assistance in dealing with an impending threat from a wolfpack
during the upcoming winter. My task was to eliminate the wolves and retrieve a pelt from one of the great black wolves as evidence.
Upon completion, I was to deliver the pelt to the secretary in Michael Delving.

I bravely battled the mighty wolfpack during the fell winter and successfully obtained a pelt, which was presented as proof of
my triumph to the Mayor's office in the Shire.
walkthrough:
You must kill the great wolf from the Shire wolfpack and bring his fur to the secretary in order to receive citizenship. The 
wolfpack repops each winter in Dwaling in the Shire, once per winter. Usually it consists of 4 pack leaders (great black wolves) 
and 18 grey/black/huge black/starving ones. Each person who needs citizenship needs their own silvery fur and also needs to have 
the great black wolf in their trophy.
achievement: You battled the great black wolves during the fell winter.

objective: Deliver a heavy bundle of iron rails to the miner
description:
The blacksmith's apprentice in Black Hill asked me to deliver a bundle of iron rails to a working miner, close to town. The apprentice's
usual deliveryman, Tad, was still recovering from a snake bite he received near town. To reach the miner, the apprentice told me 
to head south out of town, then turn west at the signpost, into the rolling hills. He told me a mine exists in the southwest corner 
of the hills, and that the miner would be found within it.

I delivered the bundle to the miner. He was overjoyed to receive it, and said that he would use it to finish the cart rail in his 
mine. He paid me in silver for the delivery.
walkthrough: Apprentice needs your help again, this time he ask you to bring bundle of iron nails to miner. To carry bundle you need a mount, since you will drop them if you want to carry themself. Mine is located some west-south from signpost before Black Hill village. Hand over bundle to to get reward. Reward: 10 silver, 750 xp
achievement: You delivered iron rails to a Black Hill miner, helping him complete his railing project.

location: Black Hill Village, Pungent Herbal Store
objective: Gather three flowers for the herbalist in Black Hill
description:
A herbalist in Black Hill village, in the northern part of the Tower Hills, persuaded me to aid him. A tale of sickness and a 
desperate need for a remedy moved my heart. Three plants he asked me to bring, and I made sure to note down what he said of them;

The first is often called ragwort, which grows in clusters of bright yellow flowers on a many-branched stem. It can be found in
a marshy area well to the south. Travel due south. Look for it just east of the hills, and north of the road.

The second is known as hawkweed, which grows as a cluster of bright orange flowers on a single stem. It grows on tall hills, and 
seems to prefer stony ridges. It can be found here in the Tower Hills. The best place to search for it is on the rocky ridges 
some south-west of the old tower between here and the road to Grey Havens.

The final flower is wood anemone, which is a very small but bright white flower with a yellow centre. I know it grows in one of 
the forests on the nearby plains. Travel south and east, to the plains east of the old tower. There is a pony breeder there, and 
the forest just east of his pasture is the one to search.

I brought the herbalist the three plants he needed, and he was overjoyed. He gave me an item every traveller interested in potions 
and brews should have - a herbal kit.
walkthrough: Upon entering the herbalist's store he asks if you have time to listen to his plight, nod and nod a second time when hes asks if you could help him. The herbalist looks for three very specific flowers in order to accomplish his cure. Ragwort - Located in a marsh some south. Hawkweed - Located at the Edge of a Barren Plateau near road to GH. Anemone - Located in a forest east of the Pony Breeder. Reward: herbal kit (no upgrades), random herb (cloves, athelas, bag of cinnamon)
reward: herbal kit (no upgrades), random herb (cloves, athelas, bag of cinnamon)
achievement: You aided the herbalist in Black Hill village by bringing him three rare plants.

objective: Exterminate slithering snakes in the Tower Hills'
description:
Whilst travelling across the Tower Hills, I came across a hunter whom, judging by his demeanor and willingness to teach me the 
fundamentals of scouting, seemed quite accomplished in this area. He eyed me evenly, perhaps sensing some potential within me that
I had yet to realize, for suddenly he asked for my help: slithering snakes have been reproducing in alarming numbers, striking 
from the grasses and shrubs north of the trail just outside his hut. He encouraged me to return with three of their corpses; to 
not do so, I felt, would be to miss out on more than one experience!

I headed to the area on the other side of the trail, in search for these menacing, slithering menaces. It didn't take long before 
I found the slithering snakes, judging by their aggressive behavior, I think they might have seen me long before I saw them! It 
was a heated exchange of blows, but before long I had three smelly snake corpses to bring back to the accomplished hunter. He
rewarded me with a snakeskin belt to not only keep my trousers upon my waste, but to remind me that with effort and bravery, great 
rewards are to be had!
walkthrough:
As you enter the Hunter's Cabin, the hunter will ask for your help, nod and then again when he asks if you are ready for snake 
hunting. Kill 3 snakes in the area just n of him. Take the corpses with you and give them to the hunter.
achievement: You aided the hunter in the Tower Hills with his slithering snake problem.

location: Under the Dike, near Weathertop (from Nen-I-Sul bridge: 6w, 2n, open culvert, e)
objective: Prove my worth to the Dunadan ranger
description:
I found a Dśnadan ranger near Weathertop who gave me a chance to learn the secret of a brew that would greatly help my travels. 
He had heard stories of my conquests; but even so, did not trust me with the brew lest it fell into the hands of the enemy. He 
had put together a test that would lead me into the forgotten parts of Arda and prove that I was worthy. I was instructed to take
up this quest alone. If I took aid I would fail.

I completed the ranger's test and he provided me with the secret recipe to make the traveller's brew. I recorded the recipe in my 
herblore journal should I ever forget it.
walkthrough:
Ranger will teach his lore to well travelled and good aligned persons ("sent to Arda" is enough, "firm believer" doesn't fit) when
they complete his given task. The task involves three objects that must be brought to the ranger. The items may be different for 
each person, the following items are known as possible quest items.

*White fur from the Huge White Bear.
*A claw from a Cavern-wing.
*The heart of the Ice-Demon.
*A sickly green mushroom.

You must find these items alone (means: no same side player can be in the zone when you pick up these items). When you pick up an
item in question, no one can be in the zone, you should not be grouped, and you should not be following anyone. You need approximately 
2.8k*level tps. It isn't a real formula, though - but it works until level 27. After level 27 the formula is approximately 3.3k*level
tps. Gather all items he asked and return to him alone to receive herblore. If you fail the quest (i.e. the ranger is dissatisfied 
with the way you got the items), your slate is wiped clean in about one RL month.
achievement: You traveled far and wide to prove yourself worthy to the Dunadan ranger.

objective: Track down and cull a pack leader near Bree
description:
Beriagon, a hunter who lives in Bree, has told me about a dangerous and cunning pack leader that prowls about halfway between Bree 
and Fornost. This wolf and its pack has caused major disruptions to the livelihoods of several farmers who depend on the income 
their livestock produce. Beriagon told me to seek out and slay this wolf, and to help bring prosperity again to the troubled 
livestock industry of Bree-land. He told me that the wolf and his pack like to roam in, or near brushland, north of the city.

Beriagon thanked me for tracking and hunting down the leader of the wolf pack, and told me he would inform the farmers of the area 
of my good deed.
walkthrough:
Beriagon the hunter asks you to kill the menacing pack leader. The pack leader wolf loads in between Bree and Fornost, east of 
the road in a forest with many wolves. As you kill it, this quest automatically reports it back to the quest giver for you. You 
need to return back to the Beriagon to get the next step in the quest chain and say 'yes' if he asks if you are willing to continue.
achievement: You sought out and killed the leader of a dangerous pack of wolves.

location: Woody End Forest, south of Hobbition.
objective: Bring wolf and snake pelts to the Shire tanner
description:
The Hobbit tanner that lives in the Woody End told me of the dangerous wolves and snakes that live in the nearby lands, and asked
me to bring him some of their pelts. He said that slaying them would bring a semblance of peace to the land, and as a reward he 
would make me some helpful leather from them.

The old tanner of the Woody End was very happy to receive pelts to make different kinds of leather for me.
walkthrough:
The tanner in Woody End Forest will ask you to find a black wolf fur, a grey wolf fur, a white wolf fur, and a rattlesnake skin.
For every fur/skin you earn a new achievement. The items can be butchered by you, given to you, or purchased in a shop. There 
does not appear to be any timeline to finish the quest.
reward: black wolfskin wristband, grey wolfskin wristband, white wolfskin wristband, snakeskin belt, selling all the items is about 1 gold worth, 250 tps per item
achievement:
You have done business with the old tanner of the Woody End.
You helped the old tanner of the Woody End create a piece of leather.
You helped the old tanner of the Woody End create two varieties of leather for a total of two pieces.
You helped the old tanner of the Woody End create three varieties of leather for a total of three pieces.
You helped the old tanner of the Woody End create four varieties of leather for a total of four pieces.

objective: Beechbone the Ent needs help with recovering a bowl
description:
I was travelling through the mighty forest of Fangorn when I ran into one of the Ents that guard the trees. He seemed forlorn and 
I inquired as to the reason of his sadness. He told me how his beech trees had been overwhelmed by traitorous, evil birch trees. 
He could not bring himself to go back to his home to recover the only item he left there that had meaning to him; his drinking bowl. 
I offered my assistance and he pointed me to his home, somewhat further south, in an area surrounded by birch trees that seemed to 
strangle the life from all the vegetation surrouding them. He also warned me about the size of the utensils in his old home and 
suggested I take a large branch to use as a lever to help me search around for his bowl.

Following Beechbone's advice I managed to enter his old home. Once inside, and after some searching I finally found, underneath a 
jar, his lost bowl.  When I got back to Beechbone he could not withhold his happiness, rewarding me with a rough, wooden horn. He 
also shared with me its wondrous story starting with a song and then telling me of the days of friendship between the greenelves 
of Ossiriand and his people, the shepherds of trees.
walkthrough:
Find Beechbone, he is the sad ent that lives in eastern Fangorn. Comfort him and ask him 'why sad'. After asking for your name he 
will tell you his story. He will ask you to recover his bowl, once you agree with him go some w and south till you find the forest 
clearing. Make sure you get one of the very heavy branches that lie around Fangorn. You will need it to lift the jar under which 
you will find his bowl. Exit south from clearing is stranglingbirch, go all south and then type 'lever jar, go down and reveal 
bowl and take it back to Beechbone. He will thank and reward you.
achievement: You found and returned the lost bowl of Beechbone the Ent.

objective: Aid Treebeard in his quest to cleanse Fangorn
description:
I was wandering through the northern parts of Fangorn forest when I found myself near a grove of mighty oak trees. Unlike most of 
the areas in the forest, there seemed to be some evil at work; the trees were affected by some poison. I shared my concerns with 
old Treebeard who already knew of this and suspected some foul magic or worse was responsible for the blight I had observed. 
Moreover, not only did he claim that this magic was beyond him, but also expressed his sorrow at how we have slowlybecome less 
and less interested in all things natural. We seek to replace them with our own crafts - minds of metal, he called it. I left 
Treebeard's home determined to set things right and, if even for a little while, make Fangorn better for those who inhabit it.

As I explored further into the poisoned forest I found a burrow in the ground. It was surrounded by dark, poisonous roots that 
prevented anyone from entering. Noticing that simply killing them would block the entrance entirely, magic became the only possible 
solution. Using healing magic aimed at neutralizing the effects of the poison eventually made the roots vanish, leaving the entrance 
exposed. Once inside a monstrous black spider appeared from the shadows. After a fierce battle, the creature lay slain. I figured 
I should take some part of the creature back to Treebeard's so that he may find an explanation to this. After carefully butchering 
the corpse I managed to sever its chelicera.

I gave the chelicera to Treebeard who was not only satisfied with the explanation this evidence provided, but was also happy that 
I had rid the forest of its effects. He invited me share one of the marvelous draughts made from water of the Entwash, a refreshing
and marvelous reward!
walkthrough:
Go to the Treebeard's hut and 'ask tree poison'. He will talk a bit about a part of the forest which is found in the eastern portion 
of fangorn (some north of Beechbone). Once you find the poisoned forest you need to deal with the roots, killing them is of no use 
since they block the entrance down to the cave where the creature responsible for the poisoning can be found. Cast 'remove poison' 
on roots until it dissapears. Once the roots are gone, enter the cave, kill the creature and butcher it. Take the evidence back to 
Treebeard who will reward you by sharing some ent-draught with you. You have a limited time to get the chelicera back to Treebeard 
after triggering his quest. If in doubt, get the chelicera, then go to Treebeard and trigger the quest before giving it to him.
achievement: You have aided Treebeard in cleansing Fangorn.

location: Fangorn, At a Fallen Tree (2n 2e from Leaflock).
objective: Free the axe buried deep in the Ent's back
description:
While venturing in some of the darkest depths of the great forest Fangorn, I encountered an ent who had recently been injured. 
After carefully examining me and deeming me to be a person of merit, he confided in me that he was unable to remove the axe that 
was stuck in his back by himself. He implored me to assist him.

The axe was buried deep in the ent's back. I had to free both of my hands in order to get a proper grip upon it. With great effort,
I was able to wrench the offending object loose, whereupon the ent immediately seized it and snapped it in twain. He offered no 
reward other than his heartfelt thanks, but that was more than sufficient.
walkthrough:
Find the beech tree with this axe in his back. It mutters about an axe in his back. When ent turns around and exposes his back, 
free your both hands and 'remove axe tree'. After that he destroys the axe and will reward you with xp.
achievement: You helped an Ent by removing an orc axe from its back.

description:
As I cleared that massive fungal growth that impeded my travel east, I became aware of the figure of what seemed to be a tree. 
Upon closer examination it was clear I was in the presence of an Ent who had gone almost tree-ish. I attempted to draw it out of 
its slumber by sharing stories about the orcs, burįrum as the Ents call them in their tongue.

He slowly awakened and thanked me for bringing him out of his slumber. He gazed at the diary I had with me and I decided to give 
it to him. He was very grateful and shared with me a recipe to make leaf-cakes, a concoction he said would help me cure some of 
the pesky diseases that can be found affecting the people of Arda.
walkthrough:
Locate the diary of a long dead traveler, it loads in an abandoned village 2s w 4s 2e from the entrance to the orkish mining camp. 
Once you have the diary go to the sad looking tree in Fangorn, he loads near Treebeard (4e n 5e n 6e 2n e) east of the room with 
3 brown funguses. Kill the funguses to enter his room. Once you find the sad looking tree, 'say orc' a few times in westron, make 
sure you have the diary in your inventory. Give the diary to the tree.
achievement: You have awakened a drowsy ent in Fangorn, and learned how to prepare a potion to cure the flu.

location: Dol Guldur, Smoky Overhang; Eastern Fangorn
objective: Bring Gurgur a massive spider's chelicera from Fangorn
description:
As I was wandering about in the Morgundul Encampment, Gurgur the Blight started talking to me about poisons. Maybe in amusement. 
He talked about his preference for slowly killing our enemies. He spoke of the use of poison, especially those from the great 
spiders of old. He then told me about rumours of a lair far south in the forest of Fangorn. He said that, should I bring him back
the fangs of the beast he would provide me with a worthy weapon, if I paid him the right price.

I found the chelicera of a great monstrous spider and brought it back to Gurgur who demanded 10 gold coins. I paid him the dues 
and was handed a spider's fang in return.
walkthrough:
Gurgur from Morgudul Encampment in Dol Guldur ask you to bring him chelicera from spider in Fangorn. This quest is dark side version 
of 'A blight in Fangorn' quest. Cast 'remove poison' on roots until it dissapears, kill the spider and bring chelicera to Gurgur 
in Dol Guldur. When asked hand over 10 gold to recive spider's fang.
reward: Spider's fang (6 charges of l22 venom)
achievement: You delivered the chelicera of a monstrous black spider to Gurgur the Blight.

objective: Travel the lands and learn about the Entwives
description:
While travelling the lands between Rohan and the fair forests of Lotholórien I crossed the mighty forest of Fangorn. Nearing the 
Entwash, I decided to take a short rest and, near a small river I met old Treebeard, after who the forest is named. Among the 
stories he shared with me, he talked about the entwives and mentioned that I should seek Leaflock nearby north of the Entwash.

Harle and I then took the perilous journey from the Old Forest back to Fangorn and to Treebeard's lands. Treebeard could not hide 
his joy at the news Harle and I brought to him and shared with us one of the fabled draughts from Fangorn, strange magicks certainly 
influence the waters of the Entwash!
walkthrough:
Ask Treebeard 'entwives', then go to Leaflock and ask him about it too, repeat this for Rengold and the Dunadan ranger. Leaflock 
is 2w 2s from the darkened orkish axe tree: "An enormous tree, overgrown with moss, is here." is his description. Rengold is just
southeast from the Isenford, and the Dunadan ranger is the one behind the culvert, near Weathertop. You will finally find out that
you are looking for a hobbit named Harle. He can be found either in the Bywater Inn, in the Green Dragon, or in the Floating Log 
in Frogmorton. His description is: "An aloof hobbit is here, babbling wide-eyed about his adventures." and his name will change 
from "an aloof hobbit" to Harle after you agree to lead him on his quest. Ask him 'entwives', he will talk, then ask if you're 
willing to go with him. If you agree, he will follow you; bring him to Tom Bombadil, then once he's finished there, take him to 
Treebeard.
If you are doing this quest a second time you can skip the first part of the quest.
Harle can ride. Find a a pony or a mule and say 'lead'. He will auto-lead and auto-ride afterwards.
You must complete each part of the quest and each part gives 250tps.
achievement: You have escorted Harle all the way from the Shire to the depths of Fangorn, to bring the evidence about the entwives to Treebeard.

location: Vine-covered Arbour, north from Caras Galadhon.
objective: Release the tortured spirit below the Golden Wood
description:
Whilst roaming the unparalleled splendour of Lothlórien, I noted that the normally flawless garden of Anarwen was fading. Worse, 
a sinister mist seemed to be seeping from the very ground itself. As I searched further, I encountered Anarwen herself. Her eyes 
pierced me to my inner core, but she must have been satisfied with what she found. She told me of an evil, tortured spirit that 
had found its way into a cavern beneath the Golden Wood. She begged me to release it so that the forest can once again flourish.

I descended far into the depths, where I found a large cavern. The tormented spirit was there, having taken the form of a cloud 
of mist. In its pain, it attacked me at once. I fought valiantly against it, despite an icy wind that struck at me again and again, 
threatening to weaken my resolution and sap my strength. At long last, the cloud vanished and the spirit was released. Anarwen
rewarded me with a few coins, along with some potent herbs carefully selected from her garden. The greatest reward, however, was 
seeing the forest thrive once more.
walkthrough:
Find Anarwen the priestess resting northeast in the zone in the garden. Examine tree to see if the quest loads, if it says 'The 
mallorn-trees seem to be afflicted by some disease' then the quest loads, if it says, 'The twin mellyrn stand proudly on the sides
of the entrance to the arbour' then no quest. It is also possible to examine 'flowers' to see if they are fading or not. She will 
talk to you and if you agree some exit down opens. Kill the cloud of mist 2d and Anarwen will be happy.
achievement: You helped Anarwen to release the evil spirit that had crept under the roots of the Golden Wood.

objective: Set Dagnir's spirit free by recovering a lost amulet
description:
South of the shades of Lothlórien lie lands that were once home to many Elves and Men. Now rarely travelled, these lands harbour 
the spirits of those that once fought the minions of the Dark Lord. It was one night, shortly after sunset that I met one such a 
spirit. Its gray form revealed the vise of a once noble man, a mighty warrior that once fought the evil creatures that prowled the 
lands. It seemed forlorn, with his thoughts lost in time. As he became aware of me he looked at me and asked to share his story.
He chuckled at my agreement and began his narrative.

He recalled a night of strife, of fire and sword when the Orcs ran in defeat from them. As they gave chase they entered a treacherous 
swamp. But a strange mist arose from the waters and provided the evil creatures with an unexpected hiding place. It was one of these 
Orcs that, taking advantage of the mists, stabbed him dead. Unfortunately his spirit was trapped in between worlds, his will bent 
towards an amulet on his person, a gift from one of the Elves of the Golden Wood. Then he blurred slightly and continued to wander. 
I left south, seeking to bring peace to the soul of this once mighty warrior.

As I entered the swamp a mist appeared to be covering the ground. Then out of nowhere I was grabbed by something in the mist and 
dragged down, into the murky waters and through the mud. As I sank deeper I thought I neared my death. Then, suddenly, it was over, 
the mud that surrounded me gave way and opened into a dark cavern. I had barely recovered my senses when I noticed, hiding in the
shadows, dreadful mottled snakes and large subterranean lizards. After doing away with the nasty reptiles I searched the cavern. 
I found a skeleton, on it a rusty medallion that almost confirmed it belonged to Dagnir. I took the medallion and used the remains 
of the large lizards to reach the cavern roof and pushed myself through the muddy ceiling back to the surface of the swamp.

It was night when I finally ran into Dagnir's spirit again and returned the amulet to him. He looked at it with joyful yet sad eyes. 
The words that followed made me realize what had transpired. This was a gift of love; it was a love not meant to be, for the ways of 
Men and Elves are separate on Arda. But the relief brought to Dagnir would finally allow him to depart Arda. As his shade slowly 
vanished, the medallion dropped to the floor. I picked it up only to have it crumble in my hands like a bunch of dry leaves leaving 
behind a jade-encrusted key. Intrigued I searched the nearby area and found a hatch. Upon entering it I found myself in front of an 
arch, closed by locked doors. The key fit the lock and I entered the chamber beyond. There, after a quick search, I found the small 
treasure. No doubt left behind to assist those who would fight against the Dark Lord.
walkthrough:
Dagnir's ghost is visible at night only. When you approach him, he starts talking. Nod when he asks if you want listen to him, and
listen. After he finishes, go to marshes and let the mud suck you into a small cave. There in the cave live 4 mottled snakes and 
2 subterranean lizards. In random room of caves lies a skeleton - loot it. To get out you need to kill both lizards and drag their 
corpses to the central room - you can only climb up stepping on the lizard corpses (mottled corpses don't fit). Walk back to ghost 
and give him medallion from skeleton. Listen to him until his trapped soul goes free, then try to pick up the medallion. It will 
crumble and reveal a jade-encrusted key. Go east, open hatch, down, unlock/open archeddoor, 2 south, open curtain, west and loot.
reward: 8000 xp, double edged eket, amethyst, softly glowing green cup.
achievement: You freed the spirit of Dagnir the Man.

objective: Find the key on the east side of Anduin for Ecthelion
description:
While in Lothlórien, Ecthelion noticed an envelope I was carrying and asked to see it. He read the letter, written by Ereniel, 
and suggested that if I find the key mentioned in the letter, he might be able to provide more information. The letter mentioned 
that the key was hidden in a secluded cave on the eastern side of Anduin.

I found the key and returned with it to Ecthelion who then examined it. The leaf, though damaged, showcased the work of a great 
craftsman, with intricate veins etched into its surface. Ecthelion restored its green shimmer and handed me the restored leaf. 
"May you find it a tree to grow on, and may it bring you good fortune," he added.
walkthrough:
You need to find the key and letter that load in two skeletons east of the Anduin. The letter loads in a skeleton inside a cave, 
guarded by a tentacled beast. You can find the cave from the exit "mud" (where lizards appear) by going 4n all e n d d. Kill the 
beast and loot skeleton. The letter will hint you the name of the room where you find the next skeleton. Find room (it is not far 
from there) and open rockpile. Go down and kill first room of snakes. The rooms here seem unstable and I think casting earthquake 
spells might be a BAD idea. Open collapse and go east. You will find MORE snakes in an even more unstable room (exit back closes 
on entrance so you need to re-open if you are going to try to flee). In addition there is muddled damage from falling debris. Kill 
rattlesnake and loot skeleton for key (leaf). Take letter and leaf to Echtelion, who will mend key. Now go to waterfall that is 
found 6e s e from "mud" this will lead you to underground cavern. Secret door s in eastern room is wall. Put leaf wall, open and 
loot chest. You have to swim underwater to get out into the Anduin.
reward: 2500+ xp, a small elven bag (endless water+lembas wafers and ropes, fishing rods and hunting knives)
achievement: You have acquired a fixed leaf-shaped key, made of shimmering metal. It must be important!

objective: Bring a hithlain plant to Cirel
description:
I was wandering in the fair forests of Lothlórien I happened to meet a dedicated artisan. His long fingers carefully worked with 
delicate yet strong threads weaving them into strong ropes. I asked about these threads, which are called hithlain in the tongue 
of the Silvan Elves. He told me they come from a plant of the same name, found in wet areas and grow surrounded by a natural fog. 
He also told me that Cirel the Navigator, who makes the boats of the Galadhrim, was his major provider of such plants given that 
he no longer travelled beyond the enchanted forests ruled by the Lord Celeborn. Moreover he hinted as to the fact that these rare 
plants do not grow west of the Misty Mountains.

In my travels through the lands east of the Misties I found, in some wetlands, a tall silvery plant surrounded by mist. I recalled 
the description given to me by the Elven ropemaker from Lothlórien and immediately recognised it as hithlain. I promptly collected 
it and took it to Cirel the Navigator. He examined it carefully and reciprocated my gift with one of his own, a fine elven rope.
walkthrough:
Ask the ropemaker about 'hithlain'. He will talk for a while, then direct you to Cirel the elven navigator (southeast of Caras 
Galadhon, north of the river). Find a misty plant, which loads in various locations by rivers in Lorien and the Anduin Vale, and 
bring it to Cirel. He will give you a fine elven rope; this rope can be retrieved from the bottom of slopes, but it may only work 
for whomever has done the quest to obtain it. Giving the plant to Cirel also allows you to earn the fine elven rope, although 
sometimes he only gives 2 gold as a reward.
achievement: You found a misty hithlain plant and brought it to Cirel.

location: A Cosy Flet, Western Lorien and OOC
objective: Search for lady Annariel on Ithildir's behalf
description:
Ithildir is distraught; his mentor and friend, lady Annariel has gone missing in suspicious circumstances. I cannot bear to see him 
suffer such sorrow and have agreed to go in search of her. The beryl ring he has given me will show Annariel that I am true of heart. 
I only hope that I can find her, and quickly.

Never have I seen such joy! Annariel's rescue from her torment has restored Ithildir's hope. It may take many months before she 
is fully healed but Annariel will get the very best care from lady Galadriel. The reward that Ithildir gave me is nothing when 
compared to the knowledge that I have saved a brave and noble lady from the torture she has had to endure.
walkthrough:
Enter Ithildir's room 2n u from greenery in the west Lorien zone and he will start talking. When he asks you 'Are you seeking safety, 
adventure, or fighting our common foe?', say 'adventure'. He will continue talking and nod after he has asks you to help him. Then
he asks you to bring home Annariel Tingliwinde and gives you a beryl ring, so that she recognizes you as the rescuer. Annariel is 
a captive in OOC, 2n from the orc prisoner. Kill the Sage and loot his key in order to unlock the door north. Adrahar the apprentice,
who guards there, flees when you enter. Give the beryl ring to Annariel and group her when she starts following you. Annariel will 
not follow you if you decide to jump from OOC backway, you must walk her via Redhorn Pass to Ithildir. Take her out from the OOC 
and protect her. On the Redhorn Pass you are ambushed by Adrahar, 2 uruks and 2 orcs. A Morgundul uruk plants a solid kick in Annariel 
Tingliwinde's rib-cage, and she collapses and falls to the ground. Kill them, on bad Adrahar flees and you can hunt him in Redhorn 
or skip. Cure Annariel after Adrahar dies or flees, you cannot do that when he is in the room. When you arrive at Ithildir, he 
rewards you with a silver morion.
achievement: You have rescued Annariel Tingliwinde from captivity.

location: Village west of Lorien on the way to Fangorn
objective: Help the old woodcutter by giving him a new axe
description:
Jeraton and his wife, Berel, are struggling to make a living in their village. Age has not been kind to him and he is struggling 
to find a replacement for his worn out axe. Normally he would walk to the civilised lands to the east to trade for a new one but 
he is too frail to make such a long journey. If I was able to find a new axe for him I could help this family in their time of 
need.

I saved them! The new axe will let Jeraton earn enough to provide food for his family. In return, Jeraton gave me what was once 
his prized possession, a stout oaken stick that will surely help me on longer journeys.
walkthrough:
As you explore the village one of the women (Berel) will try to steal from you (and fail). She will then tell you of her problems 
and direct you to her husband (Jeraton). When you find him he will elaborate on this and ask for your assistance in getting a tool 
for his work. Get him a woodsman axe and he will thank you and reward you.
achievement: You obtained a new wood axe for woodcutter Jeraton, so that he can make a living.

objective: Return with items from the enemy in the vicinity
description: Lazrria mentioned that her soldiers have been finding nearby objects of the elves. She demanded that I bring anything elvish in the vicinity to her, or that she would cut off my ears. I returned to Lazrria with an item of the enemy that was found in the vicinity and she promptly burned it in the fireplace. Walkthrough: Lazrria the Orkish Commander demans you to bring him anything elvish in the vicinity of her. Known items sofar are Elven letter, A dented, dull leaf of metal.
walkthrough:
Lazrria the Orkish Commander demans you to bring him anything elvish in the vicinity of her. Known items sofar are Elven letter, 
A dented, dull leaf of metal.
reward: Elven letter - 887 xp in first time; A dented, dull leaf of metal - flask of orkish draught.
achievement: You gave X items from the enemy to Lazrria that were found in the vicinity.

location: Lorien, Tethel's Flet; Redhorn Pass; Rivendell, Hall of Fire
objective: Find a lost tome and bring it to Quenaire in Rivendell
description:
I met a ranger named Tethel in a flet high above the ground, in the western outskirts of Lórien. She told a tale of an unfortunate 
Elf who met with a gruesome fate in the Redhorn Pass. I agreed to look for a valuable tome that the Elf carried. Look in the snow 
at the base of a great crag in the pass, she told me; and if I should find the tome, to bring it to Quenairė in Rivendell.

I managed to return the damaged tome to Quenairė. He truly appreciated it, although he was also anguished to hear of the terrible 
fate of the Elf who had originally borrowed the tome. He promised to recommend me to the Lady of Lothlórien, should I need such 
recommendation! I am to ask Quenairė about a letter when and if I decide that I need one.
walkthrough:
When you enter, Tethel may ask you if you are headed West. If she does and you agree with her, then she will tell you of an unfortunate 
elf who met a grisly end nearby. The dead elf was carrying a tome to Rivendell. You must seek it in the Redhorn Pass where it loads 
hidden. If you find the tome and take it to Quenaire in Rivendell, you will be rewarded and given a letter.
achievement: You have returned the lost tome to Quenaire.

location: Lorien in the general area of Caras Galadhon.
objective: Chase the white stag through the woods
description:
As I walked the paths of the Golden Wood, I saw a great white stag, unlike any other creature that walks the beautiful forests 
that surround Caras Galadhon. He looked at me and jumped away quickly, vanishing into the trees and bushes.

Intrigued I asked Curundil the Master Fletcher, whose knowledge of the forest and its inhabitants is second to none, about this
majestic stag. He confirmed that this stag is unusual and that it seems to want to lure hunters into a chase around the golden 
woods. Moreover he shared the fact that it is a truly daunting task to keep pace with this beautiful animal. I decided to seek 
out the stag and see if I can match its speed and endurance in a chase around the woods!
walkthrough:
Find the White Stag in the forest, and start chasing after him as he runs. After a (long) while of chasing him, he will thank you 
for the chase, lead you to a reward, and disappear. Note that he moves via mudlle, so you cannot just 'follow' him. His movement 
is always one of two possibilities: First he will go one room in the direction it says he ran, then he will go either one extra 
room in that same direction, or one room in either perpendicular direction. (For instance: If it says he vanishes in the forest 
to the east, you will either find him 2e, or e n, or e s.
reward: 4000 xp, forest green cloak, large wooden wall shield, an amethyst, an elven shortbow.
achievement: You chased the white stag till the end of his run through the woods of Lorien.

objective: A gnarled old tree in Mirkwood demands tribute
description:
While exploring the darkest depths of Mirkwood, I came upon what must be an ancient Ent. It is clearly mad, changed and corrupted 
by the dark powers that seep through the forest. It set me a task, though if it is wise to aid this creature in any way is doubtful.

Either way what it said was: The sable heart of beasts that soar the heights; the slivers of bitterly cold winter nights, these 
shall be your tribute to me.

I guess it expects me to bring it something.

The sable heart turned out to be the black heart of a fell beast, and for the bitterly cold sliver I brought the gnarled tree a 
shard of black ice. Seemingly satisfied with these gifts, the creature gave me a bowl of draught to quaff, which I did. In hindsight 
that seems like a questionable decision, yet it had a marvelous effect on my agility. Hopefully it had no other so far unknown 
side-effects...
walkthrough:
NB! Reward cannot be combined with growth and vigour effects!
Before starting the quest, obtain a black heart and a shard of black ice: do yourself or get from another player. Black heart loads 
from Frayed fell beast in CA or Scarred fell beast in Emyn-nu-Fuin, shard from a Cloud of black, icy shards. Go to East Mirkwood 
to area around Centre of the Twisted Woods and kill oaks and a darkly gnarled tree. Do not kill next gnarled tree because it's 
the quest mob, who summons more oaks and vines. If you get hit by gnarled flee and do oaks and vines. Kill all mobs he summons 
and then give one by one items to a gnarled tree for rewarded. After quest is completed you can kill it if you want.
achievement: You brought Oakscar the gnarled ent the objects he desired.

objective: persuade Rahku to teach the secrets of climbing
description:
Deep in the forest Mirkwood, I met an old but agile looking troll who was rumoured to master the art of climbing. Recalling some 
painful experiences I'd had when attempting to climb, I decided that I want to learn it too. When I demanded that Rahku teach me, 
he refused! What an oaf! Instead, he appeared to be focused only to his next meal. He did say he could teach me a little, if I 
brought him the corpse of a great, known fighter to eat.

I learned that Rahku can be very picky on what he accepts to eat. Nevertheless I managed to drag a corpse of a famous fighter to 
him. Rahku devoured it, and was so satisfied about his meal that in return he agreed to teach me!
walkthrough:
Go to Rahku and ask 'climb', if he says 'One day, Rahku may consider teaching you', it means quest is not active. If he says: 
'Bring me a delicious, fresh puke corpse… Good, red meat!', it means quest is active. Wait until he finishes talking, if he asks 
'Is it a deal?', agree Rahku. After that give him corpse. Corpse must be white warlord, who had to be on white warlord list before 
killing him, but not after.
reward: Ability to practice 3 pracs of climb.
achievement: Rahku the Mountain Troll accepted to teach you how to climb like a spider!

objective: avenge her sons at the hand of a nasty man
description:
I met a sad troll mother in the dark forest of Dol Guldur who rambled incessantly about the deaths of her sons. She was fettered 
by a huge iron collar that was clamped down on her neck. She described how a nasty man used his hand to open the collar with a 
loud click. She asked me to bring her his hand so she could be free once more.

The sad troll mother was so happy when I brought her the nasty man's hand. She immediately used the bloody hand to remove the 
collar from her neck before gobbling the hand down with a burp! She then warned me that she had eaten the chain that the collar 
was once attached to (causing her to defecate for days) and then discarded the collar unceremoniously on the ground to celebrate 
her freedom.
walkthrough:
A sad troll mother in the dark forest of Dol Guldur rambles incessantly about the deaths of her sons. She was fettered by a huge 
iron collar that was clamped down on her neck. She asks to bring her Magus hand so she could be free once more. Magus lives in 
nearby tower. Kill and butcher him for hand, bring it back to the troll mother.
achievement: You lent a hand to the sad troll mother.

objective: Bring Beorn's head to the Great Goblin in Goblin-town
description:
As I ventured through Goblin-town, the Great Goblin himself beckoned me closer. He spoke of the terrible bear-man, Beorn, who has 
been a relentless thorn in his side. The Great Goblin's voice was filled with venom as he detailed the many ways Beorn had thwarted 
his plans and killed his minions. He then offered me a task: to hunt down this shape-shifter, slay him, and bring back his head 
as proof. In return, the Great Goblin promised me riches and the title of Hero of Goblin-town.

With the head of the bear-man in hand, I returned to Goblin-town and presented it to the Great Goblin. He crowed in triumph, placing
the head on a spike and proclaiming himself the Slayer of the Skin-Changer. His eyes gleamed with malice as he turned to me, sneering 
and bestowing upon me the title of 'Lucky to be Alive.'
walkthrough:
Great Goblin will ask you to bring him the head of Beorn. Quest triggers only when artifacts load. Killing Beorn is not an easy 
task, a group is needed. Slaying Beorn the first time will grant you achievement. After butchering corpse bring the head to Great 
Goblin. Artifacts will load on Great Goblin himself and he will give you only achievement. To get items, kill him.
reward: The Great Black Scimitar and Crown of bones.
achievement:
You have slain Beorn, the mighty skin-changer!
You are lucky to be alive after helping the Great Goblin of Goblin-town.

objective: pay for Eoghha's services and find the smoke's source
description:
In a damp cave within the Ettenmoors, I chanced upon Eoghha the Hillman, who revealed tales of smoke billowing from the heart of 
the Misty Mountains. The tracker made a captivating proposition: for a sum of 20 gold coins, he would act as my guide to find the 
formidable fire-breathing dragon.

I paid the sum, and Eoghha told me that he awaited my arrival at my camp in the heart of the treacherous Misty Mountains. The camp 
was just east of a spring, beyond the thundering falls. He said that if I didn't arrive within two moons, he would return home, 
satisfied that he had fulfilled his duty.

I followed Eoghha deep into the heart of the Misty Mountains and found the source of the smoke coming from the depths of a hidden
cavern. A deep, thunderous *SNORT* reverberated ominously from within.
walkthrough:
Go to Eoghha (4e 4n 4e 8n 12e from Rivendell moors) and say 'lead dragon'. Then follow his instructions and pay him 20 gold. Next 
meet him at A Crude Camp (some w of slag), follow him there and he will lead you to entrance of Mithnaur the Dragon and open it.
achievement: You paid Eoghha for his services to find smoke among the Misty Mountains.

objective: Bring herbs to Thrakghash for his research
description:
In Goblin-town I met Thrakghash of the Mordor Flame, teacher of the Dark Arts of our Lord. He tasked me with finding a number of 
herbs to help with his research.

I have brought him the flowers of an alpine poppy, the yellowish petals found on the foxtail plant, a handful of dried mauve petals, 
and a ginseng root.

Now he said he will give me a reward if I bring him a book on herblores.
walkthrough: Reward: herbal kit upgrade.

objective: Bring a shiny trinket to Gruksh to learn the recipe
description:
I asked Gruksh how to mix orkish draughts and he very tersely said it'll cost me. I need to somehow find and bring him a nice jewel 
or shiny trinket in order to learn the secret recipe.

I found and gave Gruksh what he wanted and he provided me with the secret recipe to mix the orkish draught. He told me to listen 
carefully and I memorized the necessary ingredients.
walkthrough: Bring a gem (any gem except amethyst) to the Gruksh and he will teach you the herblore.
achievement: You have learnt to mix orkish draughts from Gruksh, in exchange for a shiny trinket.

objective: Bring the corpse of a whitepuke hero to the loremaster
description:
I was promised a great reward by the orkish loremaster if I would drag the corpse of a whitepuke's great hero to him. Seeing as 
how corpses don't last very long, I would have to hurry if I wanted to receive this reward.

I slew a great whitepuke hero and dragged his cold remains over to the orkish loremaster who rewarded me with a red-striped orkish 
battle-horn. He told me to blow it in battle and that it would increase the bloodlust of my fellow orcs along with calling for 
help from our nearby animal friends.
walkthrough: Bring the corpse of a whitepuke hero to the loremaster and you will recive reward for it.
achievement: You brought the cold remnants of a whiteskin to the orkish loremaster, and got a powerful horn as reward.

objective: Escape to Goblin-town from the Home of the Morruhk
description:
It was in my home caves that I was roused from sleep to noise that didn't belong. Loud clashes of metal on metal echoed from a 
Zaugurz raid as they slaughtered my tribe. I had to make my escape!

I made it to the outdoors, finally free of the death trap that my home had become. I realised there is only one way to go: Goblin-
town to the east. I was convinced that the larger Tarkhnarb tribe were not in danger of being overrun by the stinking Zaugurz.

Goblin-town was reached and a Tarkhnarb orc within told me to seek out Makrash in the warg kennels of the Great Hall.

I found Makrash, Warg-trainer of the Morruhk. He explained that few of our tribe escaped to Goblin-town and that it was time for 
our tribe to lick our wounds and get our revenge on the Zaugurz.

Makrash was proud of my feat, and rewarded me by grabbing my arm and etching a a pattern in my skin that would heal into the mighty
scar of the soldier.

objective: Free the captured travellers of the High Pass
description:
While exploring the eastern reaches of the Misty Mountains near the domains of the Great Goblin, I stumbled upon a troll hideout. 
It appeared that these trolls had been ambushing travellers along the High Pass, and some unfortunate individuals were still held 
captive, presumably for sinister intentions.

As the last of the trolls fell, I found, on among the bodies, a key to the prison in which they held their captives. As I walked 
in, one of them, obviously a Gondorian of noble blood, bowed my way and I beckoned him to follow me to his freedom. As he acknowledged 
my request, his companions stood up and followed him. I quickly led them out of the troll lair and upon being sure of their freedom, 
Duinhir of Blackroot Vale, for such was his name, thanked me and, before leaving to continue his journey, he gave me a small magical 
scroll, written on a piece of vellum.
walkthrough:
First kill/bash/blind mountain troll on stonetrap, he guards exit down. Go down, west and kill 2 ologs. Loot green iron key from 
the corpse of one of them, unlock/open prisondoor and go n. You can also pick/bash/break door. If there is noble prisoner (Duinhir 
of Blackroot Vale), beckon him. Lead him outside of prison, then he will give you vellum scroll as reward for saving his life.
achievement: You rescued Duinhir of Blackroot Vale from captivity in a troll cave.

objective: Aid Haldin and the Rohir by defeating Broghha
description:
While travelling near the River Isen, somewhat south of Isengard, I made a short stop at a fort of the Rohirrim. While resting I 
was hailed by the leader of the garrison, one Haldin. He told me of a bandit chieftain, Broghha, who had been raiding their lands 
and made his abode in the lands west of the Isen, in a walled village compound by the name of Wulfston. He then proceeded to ask 
for my assistance in dealing with this threat. He required me to bring back the spear of the Dunlending chieftain as proof of my 
deed stating that I would be rewarded for it.

I found Broggha and his cohorts in the village the locals call Wulfston. After a long and exhausting battle the leader of the bandits 
was defeated. I claimed his weapon, a finely crafted spear with a steel-tip, as requested by Haldin. Upon seeing the weapon, Haldin 
recalled its prior owner, a mighty warrior and, as he spoke a magnificent horse, such as those that are raised by the rohirrim, 
made its way to us. Haldin mentioned that it was the horse of the a the mighty warrior warrior felled by Broggha and his minions 
and found it fitting that it remain with me, as a reminder of my service to the men and women of Rohan.
walkthrough:
Haldin will start speaking, seemingly at random. He says that Broghha, who lives in Wulfston, west of the Isen, has been giving 
him trouble. He asks that you kill him, and bring him Broghha's spear as proof of the deed. Kill Broghha, and bring Haldin the 
steel-tipped spear.
achievement: You brought Haldin the Marshal the spear of the Dunlending chieftain Broghha.
